Reviews.Title: “Great location Tragic motel”
Reviews.Author: Geoff E
Reviews.Content: Strange humidity in the hotel all weekend, oddly it seems more humid in the room with the ac running than it is outside. Casual continuous party in the sitting area near the elevators which echoed through the entire hotel through the night. Woke up to 2 employees screaming in our beautiful view of the parking area in the middle of the motel. There is a sound that can only be described as a thunderous roar as someone walks by the room (on your floor or above). 22 dollar/nt "free" parking that is valet only, unless you arrive late at night, then you park yourself and still get to pay 22 dollars. The place has great curb appeal but once you leave the lobby its quite different than what you would expect. Very contemporary feel in the lobby, very Motel 6 when you get out of the elevator and into the room. On the upside, the employees are fantastic, the location is great. If I was 21 and in college again I would dive into this motel any day of the week and join the party that I hear all night. Restaurant/Bar was great, good cocktails and food Thank you livingsocial for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: Grace T
Reviews.Content: This place was OK for the money and pretty good on the location. The room was small and had a bit of a smell but the service from the fron desk staff including Keith and Vanessa were really responsive to our request for a room change and helped make our stay much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Italy experience - 4th floor rooms smelled very good”
Reviews.Author: Olga S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March in Upgrated rooms (had 2 rooms) on the 4th floor. I got scared by previous reviews about the smell and mold in bathrooms and agreed to the upgrated rooms and it was probably worth it because there was no mold or bad smell anywhere. The hotel building is indeed old, and the rooms felt like renovated and dressed up old rooms, but they did quite a good job on it. The King deluxe with the balcony had new toilet and bathtub and felt very fresh, bed was super comfortable with thick mattress, had refrigerator and microwave, there was some ocean view on the side of the balcony. The double queen room was large, had old toilet and on-floor-shower, but definately no mold and was clean. Mattresses were super thick. TVs were flatscreens and bright in both rooms. All locks and doors worked fine. The only thing we didn't like was The glass door restaurant which is kind of a separate business obviously popular with public, so we let them have it the way it is. Its not just overpriced, its uneatable. There's plenty alternative places to eat in the area. The other thing I liked was how quiet it was being a block away from India street. Rooms were cleaned as expected, service was not annoying. We had quite a pleasant experience. Vallet parking is 22 dollars though. Parking on the street is possible, not on Saturday or Friday night, and you have to pay at the meter anyway. We didn't have to use any air condition in March so I know nothing on how good or bad it is.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good value and good access to downtown and the surrounding area.”
Reviews.Author: adventurebuddy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a last minute type site that doesnt tell you the hotel till you book and I have to say it easily lived up to its rating. It is a great location for both downtown, little Italy and the freeway. The rooms were spacious and clean with a microwave. The hotel staff were very friendly and the valet staff very quick. If you're looking for a reasonable place to stay then this is a good option. It is essentially a motel with a fancy lobby but if all you need is a clean and comfortable room for the night then consider it.

Reviews.Title: “This place is not like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Bryn G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not anything like the pictures. I was picturing a hotel with high cielings, a nice pool and hot tub to relax in at night, free parking? (22 dollars to valet your car, or you can "park on the street" like they said, but there is a lot across the street that you can get for cheaper than 20) or even just friendly staff. This hotel provided none of these things. Besides not even giving me my welcome cocktail (a selling point on this particular hotel) they seemed like they didnt care if I asked anything, or if they could call the room next to me about the screaming baby. The front of this place looks great. Walk in towards your room and it looks like a poor motel 6. Not even a good one. There is a Days INN up the street that I loved, even that is an avg of half this hotels price. THE ROOMS AVERAGE like 150. Shower looked like it was made by a 3 year old in the arts and crafts room. Save yourself the trouble, even though I got the room at 2/3 price (which the staff will NOT respect you for). You gotta take into the account that you must valet your car there in a sketchy lot where the pool should be. Bed is ROCK HARD TOO. ok bye

Reviews.Title: “Great Service....okay room”
Reviews.Author: sabrina s
Reviews.Content: Booked a room from a great Groupon special. Customer service was AMAZING at this hotel and this is the main reason I have given it a very good rating. Otherwise would have been just okay if not dissapointing. The room was not as advertised, cute hipster room. It was a somewhat updated 90's Tuscany style room. Our bathroom had really bad mold and made the room smell like BO/smelly feet. They came up and deodarized the room, but we had to keep the window in the bathroom open our entire stay or I would have had some serious headaches from the mold. Though we had gorgeous views of the city skyline and the bay soooo wasn't too bad. Location was perfect and everyone from the managers to the janitors/handyman were super nice and friendly. Everyone wanted to make sure you had a great experience. The only downside was the room. But for the price, location, and service this hotel cannot be beat. VERY DOG FRIENDLY!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Chelexi
Reviews.Content: There must have been a convention going on the same weekend I was there because almost all the hotels I wanted to stay at were fully booked and /or the hotel rates were starting $275 -$300! I didn't want to pay that much just for 1 night, so I took my chances and booked a room on http://priceline.com and put in my bid for $140 for a 2 1/2 star hotel. I ended up getting a room reservation at The Porto Vista and from the pictures I saw, the hotel and rooms looked decent. I had seen bad reviews on http://tripadvisor.com but I brushed it off hoping that my experience would be different. The hotel from the outside looks good and the lobby area is clean and modern, but I can't say the same for the rooms, very, very disappointing!! From what i saw on the outside compared to the room was a disaster! I got a standard room with one queen bed and the room is TINY! My bedroom alone is bigger than the room! There was barely any room to fit my twin sized air mattress, and the room definitely needs renovation ..from the furniture, to the T.V, to the bathroom. I'm not claustrophobic, but staying in that room made me uncomfortable because there was no actually walking space and everything was so close to each other. I've stayed at the Super 8 and Comfort Inn in downtown SD ..and both are better and have bigger rooms too!! Pro: located in Little Italy and walking distance to shops and restaurants Cons: SMALL rooms, old furniture, outdated T.V's, ugly bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Great facade on the MOTEL... Nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Rogerfpowell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Porto Vista on 3/2/12. The lobby is nice, the club is nice, the exterior looks nice, the neighborhood (Little Italy) is beautiful!! BUT: The rooms are comparable to a Motel 6, the carpets in the hallway are dirty/stained... This must have been a crappy motel that was "remodeled", the parking structure under my room was filled with junk! Old TVs, vacuums, furniture, etc. Looked like a ghetto. SEE PIC ATTACHED!! I decided to leave after one night to stay at The Indigo, in the Gaslamp (THAT was nice!!). Anyway, the morning of my departure, I watched the valet pull my car into another car!! Needles to say, I will never stay in this dump again... Oh, the staff was SUPER friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel can do much better with improvements.”
Reviews.Author: schet84
Reviews.Content: If you are a light sleeper, do not choose to stay here. I booked for two nights and let me tell you I didn't sleep at all! I tried, but being on the 4th floor where their restaurant was located was awful. I heard footsteps through out the night, trash cans being dragged out, people talking, showers running, airplanes landing (since it was very close to SD airport), and drills going off (building next door was being renovated). The service at the hotel was good, front of the building and lobby was nice, and their Glass door restaurant was cute with a nice view of the harbor from afar. I wished they took more time in improving the decor when you walk out of the elevator to your room since it felt and looked like a motel after (I suggest more plants and flowers). Also, they should replace their toilet seat since it was worn out obviously and they had an old school ac/heater that stuck out of the wall that was all dusty. Turning the ac/heater on made me feel like I just had dust blew all over me at night while sleeping since it was directed right onto the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: marin215
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews of this hotel I have misgivings even being part of the amateur reviewer process. Dumb remarks like "don't stay here, the manager wasn't nice to us" are not helpful. So I wasn't sure what we'd think. So after two nights at the Porto Vista, here's my own two cents/recommendations : 1. The location is great. I wouldn't want to be right on India street for noise reasons. The airplanes come close, but as soon as we closed our balcony door it was quiet. We let them pick us up at the airport and waited to rent a car while we did city stuff--so parking not a problem. 2. Beds are super comfortable. After walking around the city and Balboa Park we slept like logs. 3. Great to have a fun place for an end of the day cocktail--great view a bonus (Glass Door). 4. Spring for a larger room. It's still small but you'll be able to walk around. 5. Daytime management seems with-it, night-time staff not as much. But they did give us some towels and coffee when we found housekeeping had forgotten to clean our room(!) 6. It's not fancy. If you want fancy or you are really high maintenance, you'll have to spend more money! But it's comfortable and good for folks like us who don't care for cookie-cutter Holiday Inn places. In the end, my husband said, "It's weird, because I wouldn't rave about this place but I'd definitely stay again!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: JonesJess
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely nice and helpful. It was in a fabulous location; few min walk to a number of restaurants and a short drive to the Gaslamp Quarter. Very clean, comfortable rooms. Negatives: limited street parking, but offer valet for $22 a day, weak Wi-Fi connection, and some airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: kirrabob
Reviews.Content: Close to airport, freeway, trolley, waterfront and walkable to downtown. Best part is that it's in Little Italy with many restaurants to choose from. Rooms are nice, hotel is about 2 years old. It's a 3 star at best. There is some airport noise here. Daily parking fee of $22 is a joke, use the free or meters on the street instead. Don't be put off by beggars in the nearby park or on India Street... that's just part of San Diego downtown living.

Reviews.Title: “4 Days of Great fun!”
Reviews.Author: toepickPetrolia_ON
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in the heart of Little Italy. It was clean and had a super staff. The Glass Door Restaurant on the 4th floor was excellent with a great view of the water from the bar area. A wonderful breakfast is included with your stay. The shuttle service to and from the airport was a good deal as well. I would go back any time . It is located around many nice Italian restaurants and is a 10 minute stroll to the water as well. Great spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel, Awesome Value”
Reviews.Author: Jessica L
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, Lobby modern, rooms large with a modern contemporary feel, great views of the the water and service was great! Value was good with breakfast included in room rate. the location was nice to go sightseeing in different areas of the city and have Italion food in Little Italy. I would go back again in the future. Different from your typical hotel. You will OVE the murals!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: As a student not having too much funds I wanted to getaway with my girlfriend and impress her, so i decided on this hotel in San Diego. The location was great because of all the restaurants and galleries that sorronded the hotel. Upon arrival I was greeted by the valet person who took my car. The lobby was nice and modern with comfortable couches to sit on. The front desk was nice and provided additional information on the hotel and if I wanted a upgrade, and because she was so nice I decide to splurge a bit so I git a room that had a balcony and even provided a $25.00 credit which i could use for anything. The room was clean, the bathroom had a deep bathtub which i i scored with my girlfriend and all done in marble. The bed was extremely comfortable! We had WIFI and was complimentary. We had brunch the next day in the restaurant with awesome view of the city. I would definitely come back. Enjoy and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Fuvion
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in the San Diego area and found this hotel accidentally. The rooms are large, great view. FANTASTIC value for the price range. The room was clean, spacious, awesome bathroom and the internet was free. Valet parking was a bit on the high side but justifiable due to limited parking in the Italian district area (Little Italy) where the hotel is situated. The restaurant had great views and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “It was great motel”
Reviews.Author: hiroko.holloway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for just one night, but there was nothing to say. bathroom was wide and clean. Room was also big enogh. Bed was also clean. Once we through the front dest, it looks a little dirty motel, but the room is clean and we are really satisfied with hotel. Especially the bath room was confortable for us. One night, we went to Little Italy to have some pizza. it was okay. Anyways we would like to stay at this hotel again if we go to sandiego!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Little Italy, San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a quick 2-night vacation to San Diego where we stayed in this artsy, stylish renovation of a hotel! Located right in the Little Italy district, we were able to park here and walk throughout the shops, parks, and restaurants with ease! The decor of the lobby and lounge/restaurant are really cool, and the rooms are well done. It is an older hotel building, so our room was a bit small, but for the 2 of us (plus our dog - it is Dog-Friendly, which was a HUGE plus for us!) it was all we needed to crash in while out and about. Regarding the room, the furnishings were nice! Artistic wall, flat screen & new furniture. It was small, and our room must have been close to some pipes, because we definitely could hear running water when someone else was using the shower. This was the bit that was annoying - the building is older, so the walls are not as sound insulated as some other places. In fact, one day we got back to the room for a break in the early afternoon and we could here construction (renovation?) that was happening on the ground floor (we were on the 3rd). Part of that is the courtyard openings of the hotel, so it was open to the parking, etc. on the ground floor. Service was good - and they made it easy for a dog to stay with you. The hotel is suited to allow dogs without it being a disturbance to others and easy to navigate the hallways/lobby. Little Italy itself is very dog-friendly, so this was a nice way to vacation. (A flat fee for the dog regardless of how many nights you stay!) There is a park (not dog-park) just to the East of the hotel, so easy to take the dog to do its duty. Little Italy had dog pick up bags all over the place, making it a great stay! I'll review the restaurant - The Glass Door - separately but lets say its worth a trip to the hotel just for the view, and the food was good! Overall, it was a quality hotel...good value for a great location. Walking distance (5-10 min) even to the harbor, the whale watching tours, and USS Midway aircraft carrier. Balboa Park is a short (5 min) drive away with all you can do there! We will definitely keep this place on our too stay list next time in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Advertised to be cute, but more or less a motel 8”
Reviews.Author: Annielee1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an iPhone app and it was advertised to be a cute, chic boutique at the heart of little Italy in San Diego. The lobby was about the only thing that was cute. The rooms are small, hardly any walking space, no space on bathroom counters. The room that we were in had the strongest musty smell that it made sleeping quite difficult, even after using half a bottle of perfume, it was still there. The noise was the worse. We were told that there was some "Disney on Ice afterparty" up stairs. But upon reading these reviews, I now realize that loud noise is probably a regular occurrence. I didn't like that the rooms were open to the outside; it felt unsafe especially with the droning of the loud AC, with that and everything else made me feel like I was in a dingy motel going to get slaughtered by an outsider. Also, valet is way overpriced around $30, found a parking spot on the street. Positives: staff is friendly and there is free wifi. However, I will not stay here again not even if it was $50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Pros:staff is friendly & courteous!Cons: dirty room & noisy”
Reviews.Author: MrSL0TS
Reviews.Content: Greetings again! Here's my review on the Porto Vista hotel in San Diego which we chose from the Hotel Tonight app. Let me start by saying this phone app rocks! If you use my invite code: dstanert , you will immediately have $25 credits to use ( I just checked & the Stratosphere is listed on the HT app today for $23! Yeeks! free room in Vegas)anyways back to my review: Pretty lobby but that's it. Room doors faces the outdoors. With noisy ac unit under window. Carpet had white stains(large palm size). Tub leaked. Red spots on comforter. Lots of noise at 3am. Sounded like a party next door. Front desk said it was due to people returning from downtown bars, probably true however the other hotels we've stayed at in the Gaslamp district were quiet....

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard business hotel but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Kayzzze
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 nights, had to adjust my thinking a bit as it's not your standard "business hotel" which is what I'm used to. The rooms are small but nice, clean & good bed, the walls are think, but since I was here during week no issues with noise. I have a balcony with fresh air that I love,I don't like the fact that it's a motel type that opens to the outside for safety reasons. The elevators are slow but the staff is nice. The TV is original from the 70's so if you want to watch a movie, bring your ipad the screen size is almost the same. The bathrooms are nice with marble and very new, HOWEVER. there's no counter space for even a blowdryer, just a small table would be nice for us girls with makeup. I walked to Little Italty and it was safe and really really close, awesome food. Overall this is a good hotel for the rate, I will probably come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: greengardener
Reviews.Content: I should have read these reviews - I was in a hurry and booked it. Rooms not good - I didn't even have a bar of soap in the room or tissues and they told me to come down and get it. It clearly is a party hotel - I was awakened throughout the night with drunken people coming in laughing, shouting etc. I couldn't wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is the place's best feature”
Reviews.Author: ChrisinSOCA
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in San Diego recently. Picked this place in the Little Italy area as it's close to downtown and other areas we planned to visit. While I'd like to say that this hotel was worth the price, it wasn't. From a cockroach in the bathroom to jets landing it seemed at times almost overhead, from noisy air conditioners to squeaky doors, from staff that were not all that helpful to rooms that need a face lift, this place had plenty of things that say Avoid It. If the rooms had been sub-$100, then maybe we'd have been OK with some of the inconveniences, but since they were not you'd be better off staying someplace else in the area. Oh yes, they are constructing a new building right next door also so you get to hear construction noises.

Reviews.Title: “Porto Vista Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlrdiet
Reviews.Content: Great Location!! I stayed at the Porto Vista Hotel for 2 nights for a conference. Close access to train made it easy to get around the city. Hotel is a block away from Little Italy, which was great because the food there is fantastic. My room was a little small, bed was very comfortable. I received 2 complimentary drink passess for the restaurant on site, but did not have the chance to eat there. Overall, great hotel for the money. Location, Location, Location!!!

Reviews.Title: “can't complain!”
Reviews.Author: headbuckaroo
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. I was in town for a conference, and I extended my trip to spend the weekend with some friends who are local, and this hotel was exactly what I needed. It was within walking distance from the conference, breakfast was included, the airport shuttle was convenient, my room had a balcony, the bathroom was nice and modern, and the staff were terrific! And I loved the lounge area on the roof. The Porto Vista has really done an excellent job in renovating an older style hotel building and making it hip and fun. This isn't a luxury hotel, but I don't think it puts itself out to be anything other than a hip, cute hotel in a convenient spot. If you want a luxury hotel, look elsewhere, but if you're using the room (as I was) for sleeping, in between going out and living, then look no further. The only thing I was less than satisfied with was my last night - the cleaning of the room was a little subpar that day (no toilet paper?!?!), but I'd be a jerk and a liar if I said it bothered me that much. I would definitely recommend this hotel. In fact, what prompted me to write this review was that I was considering planning a quick weekend trip, and was checking the prices!

Reviews.Title: “Mala Porto Vista”
Reviews.Author: MrCMartin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights during a recent trip to SoCal, and even though I got a pretty good deal, I donâ€™t think I would stay here again. The building itself looks very modern from the outside with a cool, chic lobby and friendly staff, but when it came to the rest of the hotel, I was not impressed. My first view after stepping off the elevator on my floor was one that reminded me of an old motel because the rooms were entered from the outside. They all had large windows that could be viewed in to, and each room had an air conditioner that stuck out of the wall next to the door. Even though the carpet was a little worn, the furniture in the room was nice. The bed was very plush and very comfortable, the armoire looked pretty new and was large, and the dresser was good. My only complaints about the furniture were that the television was outdated, and there was a desk right next to the dresser without a chair. So, it was unusable. Overall, the room was just too small for all the furnishings. The bathroom was adequate. Although I was not impressed with the room, I will say that the hotel had a great view of Little Italy and beyond. Go to the top floor for a relaxing view and fresh air. It was also in a great location being so close to dining, bars, and the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: sweetsook
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a 3 night stay and ended up staying extra two nights because of the location and service. The employees were helpful and rooms were clean. Price per night was decent as well. I would stay again and would recommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Brooke M
Reviews.Content: As an ex-resident of San Diegoâ€™s Little Italy, I can say with confidence that Porto Vista is perfectly placed in the neighborhood to take advantage of all it has to offer. You can put the car away on Friday and not think about it again until late Sunday afternoon when you reluctantly leave. There are dozens of delicious and inviting restaurants within a five to six block radius. There is a row of unique boutiques packed with treasures to explore on Fir, right in front of the hotel. Thereâ€™s an English pub, a craft cocktail spot, one of the oldest dive bars in all of San Diego, the beautiful stretch of waterfront for walks/runs, a firehouse museum, cafes with perfectly brewed espresso, gelato shopsâ€¦ you get the picture. The creators of Porto Vista know they have a gem of their own and have maximized it with the Glass Door restaurant. That gem is the view. This is my single favorite spot to watch sunset downtown; you are just high enough up to take it all in, feel the breeze, watch the boats, look down on the neighborhood as twilight washes over â€“ all while sipping your favorite glass of wine or cocktail. Well done PV, the neighbors say â€œThank Youâ€�. Take heed though, this means youâ€™ll have to compete with the neighbors for seats and if you show up at 5:30 on Friday you will probably not get an outdoor seat. However, there is a huge upper balcony that guests can enjoy. Iâ€™ve seen pictures of weddings being held up there, so there is almost always room to spread out, even with a group of friends, youâ€™ll just have to hold off on that glass of wine until you can go back to the bar. The hotel itself is cute in that boutique sort of way. Theyâ€™ve definitely got a sense of style and are economic in the distribution of those touches. We got a room on the north side of the fourth floor, complete with balcony. They are spacious with a desk, wet bar, armoire, king bed and an arm chair. The bath was large enough for two to be in comfortably. The carpet, sheets, towels and sundries were what you would expect in a mid-range hotel (think Holiday Innâ€¦ just with style) â€“ nothing fancy, but clean and suitable for a weekend get-away. Best of all, this is a pet-friendly property and very dog-friendly neighborhood (play park just a couple blocks away) â€“ so your pet can have an exciting holiday with you! I was surprised that the hotel put such a focus on the modern design but left small, old-school tube televisions in the rooms. The front desk was abrupt in their guest communication style, but this may have been a one-off for us. There is a price to pay for this concoction of boutique style, reasonable price and neighborhood placement â€“ that is the party atmosphere and late-night noise that is common with the groups of younger guests that fill the hotel on weekends. It will bother some more than others, but to me it was a small sacrifice for the long list of positives. I would recommend this hotel to singles, groups and couples looking for an authentic San Diego weekend in the best downtown neighborhood, Little Italy. Those who come to take in the surroundings will appreciate the location, the simplicity of the amenities and the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Michaela M
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel and its right next to the main street of little Italy and within walking distance to the Gaslamp district. So I was really satisfied with the location. The rooms were clean and newly renovated, but there is no pool at the hotel. They have a great bar and restaurant at the 4th floor (Glasdoor), where you can also have the breakfast. The only things I did not like about the hotel was the fact, that they charge 22$ a day for the parking, there were some constructions right next to the hotel (which caused a lot of noise in some rooms) and it was a former Motel, so sometimes it feels like a cheap place without nice details. But I would recommend it because its definitely a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Ken K
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the stay. First off No Parking, or should I say no free parking. 22.00 to park seems ridiculous on top of the cost of the room, but wait it gets worst. It's Valet parking for 22.00, to some people that wouldn't matter but I drive a 75,000. Corvette. This is not a car to have Valet parked unless you don't give a damn about it. Long story short I was assured it would not be moved once parked. They moved it three times. The rooms were small 19" tv, no cups of any kind for the coffee pot, but wait no coffee pot either, the maker was there, not even plastic cups for rinsing after you brush yor teeth.All I can say is never again......!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: 01_justme2011
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a third party and it's a shame that the hotel is getting a bad wrap for the false advertising done by these third party companies. When reviewing on line, some of the third parties showed this hotel had a swimming pool and complimentary breakfast. Unfortunately, it does not. The complimentary breakfast is only offered if you book DIRECTLY with the hotel. Nice place, good location, quiet and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Don't book through third parties, though, call the hotel directly to know exactly what you're getting. The restaurant on the 4th floor is really nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and treated exceptional well”
Reviews.Author: gary0639
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Porto VIsta Hotel for (5) days. After the first evening I got sick. We were staying in room 513. A schedule event occurred during the first night of my illness. The band's mixer was so loud my wife complained to the hotel management. John Fissette, Operations Manager and staff arranged for us to me moved to a suite on the second floor. Great room and the hotel staff took exceptional care of us during our stay. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who asks. Very busy hotel but they know how to handle large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here! Bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: Karla C
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation (for Aug. 1 with my CC) and obtained a confirmation number, I was excited to stay since they are close to Little Italy. Made several plans, even to have dinner in their restaurant. When we arrived the night of our stay, we were told there were no rooms available. The staff was rude and offered no apologies. THEY HAD OVERBOOKED! They said they would comp our room and not to worry. When I asked what had happened, they just gave me directions to another hotel. We were sent to another hotel 20 minutes away, by the time we got a room, it wasn't what had been promised to us by Porto Vista. It was late and we were so exhausted and upset, we didn't go anywhere. All the restaurants were already closed! Monday came and I checked my bank account and I had been charged!!!! I emailed the director of the Hotel and left phone messages, to this day I have not received a response. This is not only rude, but very unprofessional! I will never book at this hotel, I wouldn't trust it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and noisy and WAY over priced!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Domb171
Reviews.Content: Tired rooms with filthy carpets inside and mouldy ones on walkway. Airconditioning too old and dusty to dare turning on. Noise unbearable from those rooms who have the ac on during night. Ruined last 2 nights of an otherwise great stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “DONT COME HERE! TRUST ME! THIS PLACE RUINED MY ENTIRE TRIP!”
Reviews.Author: Drudiann
Reviews.Content: Ehere do i start...ok well first we get there @ 1030pm wet frm seaworld, cold & tired...they tell me they booked the wrong room & i got 1 bed instead of 2 w/3 kids & 2 adults but they'd give me a cot! Then they say they dont hv a pool which i was told they did...then they said the $50 incidental was only accepted by credit card.i even offered him $100 cash just to get my kids to a bed...he said no so we drove around @ 1130 looking for a visa prepaid card...finally found one he took it & when we finally got to the room we found 1 big brown spider where my kids were suppose to sleep..then i take the covers down off my bed & find another! Then sitting on TOP of the dresser was a makeup sharpener! Even if the maid wiped down the room half way she wouldve seen that! Gross! There was fingers prints all over the wood furniture & in the morning when we went to check out of the hell hole they said they couldnt refund the gift card cuz once it was taken they cant put it back..after a fight they agreed to give it back

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room, great location”
Reviews.Author: UNhappyCamper44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom, grandma, sister, and niece for a girls weekend getaway. The hotel is in Little Italy at a great location. Close to the trolly (within walking distance) that will take you all over San Diego. That is the only good thing I have to say about the hotel. Do not believe the website photos. Our room was completely outdated and had not been renovated yet. We did not have the print on the wall like the website shows. The bathroom door was a sliding glass door that was completely see thru. NO privacy from the others in your room when you were on the toilet. We were missing the smoke detector cover on the ceiling and did not have a remote for the outdated television. I called the front desk twice before someone came to the room to install the smoke detector cover. The television only got 5 channels and half the time they were fuzzy. Service was crappy. The staff was very rude and not helpful at all. The deck was completely dark and no one was up there Friday night. Saturday night, the deck was full with a 1981 High School Reunion. Very loud and noisy all night. The only nice staff member that helped us with our luggage and loading into the car when we were leaving was Mike in Valet. He was the only one we tipped our entire stay. We will NEVER stay here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well we ended up getting turfed out!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayheaven82
Reviews.Content: After a long 11 hour flight from the UK we were looking forward to the lovely boutique style hotel we had booked in downtown San Diego. Ready to start our California trip of a lifetime, after arriving at this hotel, it seemed to be doomed. Arriving at the reception we gave in our details only to be told " we have a bit of a situation here guys!". Not the best start. Already we thought the worst...and we were right. The hotel had, for some unknown reason, overbooked and they didn't have any room and we were then told "every hotel in San Diego is booked up for the entire weekend". Not what you want to hear after a long flight...our body clocks were set to it still being the middle of the night. Next, three reception staff fanatically rang round all other hotels only to be told by one they had no rooms...this was all done in front of us! They then found somewhere in the University district of San Diego called the Lafayette. A quick phone call and they seemed to be signing us up without any consultation. I asked the star rating of the hotel to be told "urm I don't know, let me check". We were told it was three star the same and that they had a pool - used as a selling point.."we don't have a pool and it's a historic building". Did the receptionist/manager not clock that it was evening and we were staying for one night...hardly going to spend time sunning ourselves around the pool!! We had no other choice so accepted. Porto Vista agreed to refund our original money paid along with the price of the room at the Lafayette (or however you spell it). I suppose this was only fair in the circumstances but having booked our California trip in Janauary and were told on the confirmation email that we didnt have to reconfirm, we were left with a bitter taste in our mouths, Not what I expected from American service. the hotel we were sent to was clearly a different standard of hotel and looked shabby around the edges - although the staff in the Lafayette were faultless - much nicer than the Porto Vista. The receptionist as the new hotel seemed bemused by the actions of the Porto vista and told us they had been turfing people out for the last week. porto vista hadn't even rung the new hotel to confirm payment details...we were left with another task on a very weary night, All said and done, it was a badly handled situation and I have lost faith in this hotel and their staff. I would AVOID this hotel at all costs. I know the manager will read this review and highlight that they provided "good service". however, I believe there was more they could have done and they could have provided the service they agreed to when I paid in full for the room in January. Despite the comeback from the manager to my review, still avoid!! Thank god we were forced to avoid as when coming out the hotel we saw women screaming their heads off hanging off balconies clearly in some sort of drunken state. Boutique?!?! I don't think!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Rayleen627
Reviews.Content: There must of been a convention going on the weekend I was staying in SD because all the hotels located in gaslamp district were sold out completely or hotel rates were at least $300 and up so I went onto priceline.com and bid $140 and my room ended up getting booked at The Porto Vista. From the pictures I saw on the website, the rooms looked decent so I figured we scored on this hotel deal. For the rate we got it was , but when we arrived to our room i was really disappointed! From the outside and the lobby area the hotel looks very modern which i love but I can't speak the same for the rooms. The room I got is sooo SMALL and definitely needs renovation all around! The furniture, T.V and bathroom needs a major face lift! My own bedroom is bigger than that hotel room! Thank goodness I was there for one night only and definitely NEVER staying there again. I've stayed at the Super 8 and Comfort Inn in downtown SD and both had bigger standard rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: 745Entertainment
Reviews.Content: I booked at this hotel before having read reviews on this site. After I read some of the reviews I stressed. I can tell you that there's really no reason to stress about this hotel. Upon arrival, I noticed that the descriptions of having to basically wait awkwardly in traffic to get into the parking garage are true. It wasn't the worst experience of my life, though. The check-in staff was friendly and helpful. However, and I believe this is more Southwest's problem than the Porto Vista's, they didn't know anything about being a Rapid Rewards partner when I asked them (as directed to do so by my confirmation from Southwest.com). The room itself was absolutely sufficient. It was clean, the bed was comfortable, and I had a great cross breeze with the two windows open. I did notice that there was carpet in the outside hallways on the lower floors (in reference to some of the reviews complaining of wet, odor-ridden carpet), but the 5th floor had none, so I didn't experience that issue. The hotel bar (the Glass Door) has a beautiful view, and plenty of open air seating. The location was great, and I found an awesome dinner about 2 blocks away in Little Italy. Overall a great experience, especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Tired inside, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Bec
Reviews.Content: Good location with Little Italy, and the Gaslamp quarter near by. Rooms were very tight and very tired, but we weren't looking for luxury, this was simply a place for us to stay whilst we explored San Diego. The $18per day is a bit steep for valet parking as there is no self parking, just parking on the street. The Glass door restaurant is very nice, but small. The food is also pretty good. All up, an ok place to stay, but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL, AWFUL, AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: ladyofthecanyon_2011
Reviews.Content: First this is not a hotel, this is a MOTEL - I booked a room for four nights about four months in advance at a rate of $242 (wed & thurs) and $269 (friday & saturday) and I was given one of the worst rooms possible on the first floor (my view is a parking lot) next to the hotel laundry/service room. Not only was the room a cave because I could never open a window, it was depressing. Given I booked far in advance and the rates I paid for this dump, I would've expected a room at the very least on the 4th floor (there are only 4 floors). I realize the rates I paid to many is probably on the cheaper side and you're saying "you get what you pay for" - to put things in perspective, I was there for Comic Con, and the rates at the time I booked for the Hard Rock, Solamar, etc were between $330-$375 a night. It's outrageous to think THIS hotel was only $100 cheaper than either of those two hotels. I also have to believe that I probably paid higher rates than most people staying at this hotel given "appearances." I know what the hotel did - I checked in late and rather than considering multiple factors (i.e. staying for 4 nights at higher rates), they booked people as they checked in and gave me the worse room because of my late check-in. Again, this place is a dump. If you're expecting something that is not fancy but nice, this is not the place. Stay at a Hilton, Hyatt, Marriot - anything is better than this place. The only thing this place has going for itself is that it's in Little Italy. Obviously, I've learned my lesson and will NEVER come back to this place or recommend it but I'd like to make sure that noone else makes the same mistake. Stay at hotel that is owned by a notable chain - This hotel is owned by an investment group that obviously doesn't know the service industry, let alone the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Location, Staff. Just one little problem...”
Reviews.Author: jlhand12189
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Porto Vista because our room was decently priced and it seemed quite lush from internet research. When we arrived near midnight after a long day of traveling, we were pleasantly surprised to find a helpful, fun, and enthusiastic staff. They readily took care of us and suggested nearby restaurants, bars, nightlife when we asked. When we got to our room on the fifth floor, we were impressed by the awesome view of the San Diego skyline and our seemingly clean and modern room. After a very comfortable shower, a visit to one of the aforementioned restaurants, and enjoyment of the hotel's rooftop terrace, we went back to our room to turn down the bed. To our surprise, we found what appeared to be a bed bug--small, round, dark brown, legged--scurrying across the sheets to seek solace on the mattress. Shortly after the girly screams and hasty packing, we bounded to the lobby where the night staff was more than willing to move us to a different room on a different floor. The room we had then was quite nice-- spacious, clean, bed bug-free. When we discussed the issue with the hotel manager, he was more than willing to comp our valet parking (which, by the way, is about $22/day and there's nowhere else to park around the hotel). Unfortunately, his reasonable allowance did not cover the cost of our vigorous laundry-ing, dry cleaning, and the new suitcases that were required to fully eradicate the threat of bed bug infestation. It was really a shame that this happened, because the hotel itself is quite chic, pleasant, and located right in the middle of San Diego's Little Italy area. I would have wholeheartedly gone back if it weren't for the critters.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rates, good location but dubious cleanliness and wretched service.”
Reviews.Author: worldnurse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding weekend. Looked great from the outside and on the web. Sadly, it is basically a flea bag with some new paint when you get to the guest rooms. Stained carpets and bedding...gross! If the staff of the horrible restaurant hadn't been so slow and mean - the price and location may have outshined the shabbiness, but they really left a lasting impression.

Reviews.Title: “Total rip-off”
Reviews.Author: lbs4j
Reviews.Content: This place is a joke. Based on their website and rates, you would think it was a trendy and cute boutique hotel in Little Italy. The lobby and restaurant are nice enough, but that's where the cute/trendiness ends. This place is essentially a Motel 6 that has not been upgraded. The rooms are tiny - there's a desk, but no chair for some reason. Not that there's room for a chair. My room smelled incredibly musty. My bathroom was dirty and when I took a shower, the tub filled up so I was standing in water up to my mid-shins. The lighting is terrible and it's just a depressing place to stay. And to top it off, the staff at the front desk and in the restaurant were painfully incompetent. I usually had to stand around for several minutes before anyone would even bother to assist me, and then even the simplest of questions were generally met with blank stares and non-answers. The location is decent, and the views from the roof are nice, but those were about the only positives. I was there for a wedding and many of the wedding guests stayed there and agreed it was awful - next time I'll do more research before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Incerdable Service”
Reviews.Author: Perky030
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed At Porto Vista for a family funeral. From the moment we stepped in they were totally embracing. From the Valet to the Front Desk they were completly helpful and went the extra mile. The location was ideal for all our needs and they were very helpful with making sure we had all that we needed far as room service. One particular Front Desk agent contiually had a positive attitude and always went the extra mile, Keith is a real asset to Porto Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: chikabolita
Reviews.Content: In the Heart of Little Italy with great rates, a nice bar and resturaunt. Just beware of Rick the valet. I dont know if he was having a bad day but he was patronizing and made my gf and i uncomfortable. Other than that it was Great!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: SchelliD
Reviews.Content: WOW! I loved this place! Great customer service, great rooms, clean, trendy, location was great. My brother had to move rooms when we first got there because his was too small for him....he is a little picky!! So not only did they move him 3 times!! until he was happy, but they charged us a lower rate and had great attitudes the whole time. Love this place and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Honor Reservation - SDCC”
Reviews.Author: Roy1973
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attend the San Diego Comic Con every year in July. This will be our tenth year (2011). I always start looking ahead of time for good rates because this is a popular event and hotels go fast. On July 27, 2010, I found a good rate at the Porta Vista Hotel for 2011 event. My wife and I like the location and used to stay here when it was a Super 8. I remeber that we were a little hesitant about booking because it was nonrefundable, but we went ahead anyway. We booked directly through Porta Vista website and gave our credit card information. On June 23, 2011, I received an e-mail notification of "Reservation Rate Changes" and our total cost for staying doubled. I read on the Comic-Con FaceBook page that someone else had issues with their reservation. They stated that after calling and struggling with the Porta Vista, they canceled their reservation. My wife and I decided to cancel since we could not afford the doubled rate. When I called to cancel, I spoke with Anthony and informed him that we were canceling. After looking at our reservation, he hesitated and stated "Because it was Comic Con", there was a ten day cancelation policy. We called on day ten. He stated that he would cancel our reservation with no cancelation fees and that they would refund our credit card for the first night, which was charged on our "Reservation Rate Change". Why were our rates changed? If our credit card was charged on the "Reservation Rate Change", why was it never charged upon making the initial reservation on July 27th, 2010? Also, the "Reservation Rate Change" notification stated nothing about a ten day cancelation policy. It clearly states a 48 hour cancelation policy. I will be calling to speak with the manager as to why they did not honor their reservation. Luckily we had a second hotel booked. We almost canceled that the day before, but had forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and hopefully we will make it back”
Reviews.Author: dragoon149
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff and loved the location. Was a little unsure when they dont show room pictures for each style of room but the roo was exactly what I expected except a bigger bathroom. We were not able to rent a car but a lot of things were within walking distance or short cab ride. Definetly recommend if you are not old enough to rent a car or want to spend a ton in cab fares. Very close to the gay district.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back”
Reviews.Author: CALVIN55
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel last weekend,and service on the front desk was ok,location of hotel very good,no pool,carpet in the room sucked,very dirty and not good enough,loud steps in front who ever goes threw made me feel that i am staying in cheap motel which would actually cost me much less,overall not very happy with this hotel,i was expecting little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Love Porto Vista Hotel plan to go back yearly”
Reviews.Author: sunkistBostonMa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Porto Vista Hotel twice in the past two years. We love this hotel, the beds are so comfortable. The rooms are clean and spacious . The location is within walking distance to Little Italy and the seaport area . The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooftop overlooking San Diego bay is so beautiful and breakfast at the Glass Door is a plus. I plan on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Like/Hate Relationship with the Porto Vista”
Reviews.Author: PrncssMBP
Reviews.Content: We reserved a very large block of rooms at the Porto Vista for our wedding and have mixed feelings about it. The price is fantastic for a basic hotel in a great neighborhood with lots to see and do. Given the great location, the price is about the only thing that makes me give three stars instead of two. We stayed in the Midway Suite, which is situated under the restaurant, and they drag the tables across the floor at 11pm and again at 7am. We called the front desk and they were unable to do anything about it. Also the sheets are incredibly itchy and the lack of a fitted bottom sheet makes the beds really uncomfortable. As a result, we chose not to sleep in the hotel, but drove home each night and returned in the morning. The parking fee has gone up to $18 - ouch! And the breakfast vouchers were a good deal when we stayed in February, providing you any entree on the menu. However, when we stayed in June, the voucher just gets you a two-egg breakfast. Similarly, when we signed up for the room block in February, they had a free shuttle to the airport, downtown and Balboa Park. When we arrived in June, shuttle is now $5 per person (cheaper to take a taxi if there are two of you!) and no shuttle to Balboa Park. Basically, the Porto Vista's only saving grace is that the rooms are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: pad1104
Reviews.Content: Keith at the front desk was amazing and so helpful and friendly. We love the Little Italy location because it's our favorite place to be. This time we had a suite, which was great and roomy. We stay there often and always enjoy it. We have one big suggestion - since the bathroom doesn't have a counter, it would be nice to have some sort of little table or tray to put things on. The little ladder is cute, but it holds the towels, so there is no room for anything else. That is always a nuisance. We'd also like to have glass cups and glasses in the room. But all in all, we like it and we keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what it seems”
Reviews.Author: JMK1984
Reviews.Content: Went in to this hotel kind of excited with the images they portray on the website. Looks nothing like it! Got a suite because they claim it has a jacuzzi tub in it, it's your basic whirlpool tub that fits one person. The hotel room itself was said to be able to fit 5 people, how does one expect to fit five when we as a couple fit comfortable in it. They dont have room service, no wet bar as was told. The rooms look old and out dated, No occurance of Yoga on the roof, The roof top restaurant was no where to be found. The Glass Door restaurant inside is found by elevator with cheap products for an expensive price, though the chicken was good! Worst thing about the hotel besides the look and appearance though is the staff is really unwelcoming, Poor poor customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest and Underhanded”
Reviews.Author: JanMS
Reviews.Content: This hotel changed the terms of my upcoming stay and lied about having tried to contact me. A staff member helped me out but then management changed the reservtion and *tripled* the rate. When I balked, the general manager cancelled my reservations completely. Dishonest! Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Mgst
Reviews.Content: Keys didn't work went down got another didn't work waited on the open balcony cement floor for 15 minutes before someone came up and switched our rooms. The guy who let us in was the only person on staff who looked like he was working hard and actually gave good service. We were promised a free breakfast through email for booking through the hotel and then found out because we booked through a wedding party we did not qualify. While others in the party did receive this. Our special rate for the wedding party was the same price mind you as everyone else was paying. We had to ask the front desk 2 times why they didn't care or even tried to recover it wasn't until the bride called the manager that we got what we were promised but only two for the one day. I could go on with more problems moldy ceiling dirty counters and glasses. Promise a balcony if you call the indoor outdoor walkway of a motel a balcony. Apparently this hotel bates you with overpromising and underdelivering. We left 3 days early and got a hotel that was $20 a day cheaper and 100% improvement on service room qaulity and experience. I wish the staff would have been sympathetic like the manager but they were just flat out rude. I never complain but I can't help wanting to warn others.

Reviews.Title: “very ordinary, don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: marras01
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 9.00am and were told our room was ready but if we wanted to enter before 11.00am we would have to pay $30.00 for the privellege.The staff are all young and not really interested in customer service. The rooms are small, old, hot and totally out of date. It is an old hotel pretending to be new by having a modern reception area.It is a very noisy hotel as it is really a glorified backpackers.Little Italy is a nice area but the accomodation downtown looked to be of a much higher standard. Everything is so close that staying downtown is not a big drama. We constantly had people runnning up and down outside our room and on the last night had someone knocking on our door in the middle of the night, very disconcerting. We had paid online but after we checked out there were all these outstanding amounts on our credit card, different amounts on different days. I rang the hotel and they had no clue what is was about and said they would get back to me, never heard from them again. After calling my bank in australia they explained some hotels do this and they were only pending charges, they come off in 7 days. Fair enough but the hotel should be able to explain this but they had no clue.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all a 3 stars.”
Reviews.Author: travellotcities
Reviews.Content: First day missing service items. Second day big black spider in one of the towels. At night loud noises outside. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, free breakfast, exceptional view from rooftop patio room.”
Reviews.Author: LoFin
Reviews.Content: Paid avg room rate online, single night stay included two breakfast vouchers for restaurant. Friendly staff upgraded to rooftop room on check-in. Courteous even with a late night call to our room about our noise level. Mini fridge missing, but didn't need it for one night, the elevator was unusually slow for 5-floors, and ice machine in the lobby. Decent size rooms, comfy beds, large bathroom had sliding glass frosted door, good if you don't need privacy. Ample towels and above avg toiletries.. Rooftop view exceptional, lounge happy hour good, not too many choices but drinks well poured. Generous appetizers and my burger prepared as ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding outside our door no warning”
Reviews.Author: frostygirl2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, but a wedding was held outside on the patio Sat night with no advance notice. We needed sleep since we were working a convention. Staff didn't seem to care. Wouldn't stay again because of staff indifference

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: peloha1
Reviews.Content: The overall appearance is that of a eastern-block building. The rooms were clean yet nondescript. The breakfast was less satisfactory. On our last day of 5 we lost our breakfast tickets and the front desk told us we would have to buy our breakfast. This was after having to listen to a loud wedding reception outside our window the night before. If I were you I would find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: peloha1
Reviews.Content: The overall appearance is that of a eastern-block building. The rooms were clean yet nondescript. The breakfast was less satisfactory. On our last day of 5 we lost our breakfast tickets and the front desk told us we would have to buy our breakfast. This was after having to listen to a loud wedding reception outside our window the night before. If I were you I would find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A magical litte find of luxury at a dirt cheap price that you dream of after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: BerringtonBud
Reviews.Content: We booked this delightful little hotel for one night, being the cheapest we found online, as it was to be just to rest our heads after flying from the UK. We were most impressed to find that this moderately priced hotel turned out to be quiet a little charmer. From stepping into the modern, plush reception, to the friendly and most efficient staff. Our room was big, clean and had a touch of unexpected character. The breakfast at the Glass Room was first class and had a wonderful view to the marina. The staff were super helpful with getting us to where we needed to go. Plus there is a rooftop area full of lounges, sun chairs and tables to enjoy a beverage and admire the view of downtown San Diego. We were so happy with this place we booked another night. Upon checkout our invoice was already prepared and we left feeling pleased to have found a place we will return to time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the look, not the planes.”
Reviews.Author: LucasK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 3 nights from the 7th of May. Check in was quick. Rooms clean. Great selection of channels on TV. Only issue I have is with authorization. The hotel took a authorization upon check in, 3 days after check out They took their final bill total also, effectively over $1000 total. I do not accept this. After this hotel we stayed at two Travelodge properties, in Palm Springs the authorization was removed once the final amount settled. In San Francisco, they simply charged the full amount, no authorization. Location to Little Italy is excellent, however the roaring engines of planes landing at the airport was just horrible. Our room also faced the freeway, awesome. The hotel emailed me asking for an opinion & review on TripAdvisor following our stay, I responded with my comments, was not surprised not to receive a reply.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money!!”
Reviews.Author: Jfogarty6
Reviews.Content: I will never stay there again! I have never had such a horrible hotel experience. First of all we booked with a wedding party and we were supposed to get a special rate, we paid the same rate as on the website. Then our keys didn't work, we went and got new ones and those didn't work either! They said they were sending someone up, 15 minutes later someone finally comes up and moves us to a new room. There is a nasty, kind of moldy stain on the ceiling and no balcony like we were promised on the phone. The room is small, counter was dirty and there were no toiletries. Then we went to bring the car in, there was no one at the valet booth so we decided to park ourselves, the guy yelled at us, told us to go back around and he would park the car. The closest garage door did not open so we turned around and went outthe way we came in. The guy yelled at us again and told us he meant to go out the garage door, he told us to "exit the vehicle" and he would park it. The next morning we planned to go get breakfast because we got an email saying complimentary breakfast for two, it also said on the website that there would be complimentary breakfast for two. The rude guy at the front desk told us that since we were part of the wedding party we did not qualify. My friends getting married brought all the business here and we don't get the perks other people do? We are checking out days early!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and the staff was exceptionally helpful”
Reviews.Author: flynnch50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Porto Vista during the Mission Federal ArtWalk at which we participated. The staff members, from the desk to the valet parking, and the restaurant, were very helpful and friendly during this fun but stressful time. The room was lovely, comfortable, clean and well-equipped. The bed was especially comfortable after a long, hard day at the ArtWalk. I can't say enough good things about our stay! Also, it was in the heart of Little Italy and one block from our booth. We were ecstatic!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: gueishers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Little Italy where there are tons of restaurants and small great shops within walking distance. In our opinion the decoration could use a bit of an update but everything is in great conditions and the super friendly staff makes up for everything; from the valet to the sales director, to the guy who takes care of the fb page, they were all extra friendly and welcoming. The Porto Vista played a big roll on the good impression weÂ´ve got from San Diego...we canÂ´t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Porto Vista has lost its charm”
Reviews.Author: TrikyB
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Porto Vista numerous times. Our last stay was horrible. Our reservations were NOT what was requested. We had to pay more for the same room that we always stayed in and requested. Guests above us threw a party and were disruptive. Our complaints were ignored and the other guests partied hardy until 4:00 a.m. (On a Wednesday) Amenities were sadly lacking. No phone book, note pad, pens, services for the hotel, etc. The furniture has not been cared for and things look run down and yet the hotel is relatively new. Considering our last experience, we will look elsewhere when staying in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Never”
Reviews.Author: Cashmir
Reviews.Content: Great location to Little Italy. Rooms are loud, bare of anything; glasses, space in bath for articles, on and on. Party next door until 4 am; front desk not helpful. It is a young person hang out. Seriously, save your money and disappointment. I am not one to complain, but ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jturtz13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was great, just a block from all of the fun at Little Italy in SD. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bar/restaurant had good food and drinks, and the view was amazing. The bed was one of the most comfortable I had ever slept in/on. The only down side to the stay was the location to the freeway and airport, as far as some noise when the windows were open. Also, if a TV in the room is a big deal then you will be disapointed, we had a 19 inch (maybe) 10 year old (at least) TV so watching some of the NCAA Tournament was hard. Overall this was an awesome stay and I would recommend Porto Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: Drworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: For what you pay, this place is a steal. The neighborhood is quaint, cute, and pretty precious. The room's are not shabby, and you get a great breakfast included. I wish it was easier to find hotels like this (ie the price) in all major cities.

Reviews.Title: “great beds!”
Reviews.Author: smkbs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the proximity to our daughters condo. It was perfect and I felt safe walking alone at night if my husband was late with the grandkids and I wanted to go to bed earlier. The food at the restaurant was very good and the service was always friendly and prompt. We plan on returning. This IS a downtown hotel and you CAN hear planes overhead at times, but the prices are certainly great for the location and service. As in many hotels of this genre, the bathrooms could use fresh caulking around the tubs, carpets could use more frequent replacing/cleaning, and someone could certainly work on the curtain rod situation! just sayin'

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: YULwoman
Reviews.Content: Converted motel in Little Italy. A little dated in some areas, bit clean, comfortable, friendly, and a great value. I was disappointed to not have a room with one of the funky murals they show on the website. Oh well. Don't miss the view over the bay from the restaurant or the rooftop lounge, especially at sunset. Free Wifi with a strong signal! I had a microwave & sink in my room, but no fridge. Safe and relatively quiet area (no beggars like in Gaslamp). 1 block from the resturant strip in Little Italy, and about 4 blocks from the trolley. 10 minute walk to the waterfront. They offer a shuttle to airport for $5.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to entertain”
Reviews.Author: psyline
Reviews.Content: I usually grab a suite when i travel pleasure so i can have friends over, and this trip was no different. I probably had about 10 friends through the evening, and everyone had enough room to streach, recline, stand, and enjoy conversation. My room was a King Deluxe which is on the ocean side of the building. I believe there are smaller rooms across the way, but for $80-120 range this was an excellent value. Super comfy bed, nice balcony. We ate in the hotel at the Glass Door. Excellent service from the Bar Tender Tanya, and her staff as well as well mixed drinks. The Scallops we're an excellent share; nice charcuterie platter (poss too much crustini since our party had already ordered the artichoke dip). We sat for 2 hours, and were treated like royalty, although we didn't know a soul there. To me that's a sign of great service. Breakfast for 2 was included when i booked on the hotels site, which was a full breakfast including everything except tax and tip. Yoga was also included on Sunday at no charge. I didnt make it to the roof top pool, but will next time when i'm not just in for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Trying to be a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkpotato
Reviews.Content: Customer service was okay & friendly, nothing extraordinary. Room was clean, though there was still trash (food wrappers) on the table. Bed was comfortable, & we had a good, quiet sleep night. Here's what makes it a motel room: AC was really outdated & loud, and you can see it installed right outside the room. While in the restroom, you can hear the other room's shower running. The restroom itself was just okay, though we did have Bath & Body Works amenities. The location was right near Little Italy, but far from downtown for walking. I don't appreciate the hotel website advertising $14 valet parking, & then charged us $18. My bf and I had free breakfast at the hotel's Glass Door restaurant. Nice view and decoration, but they did NOT sweep the floor from the night before because we could still see trash and crumbs. Very unprofessional. I paid $103 (after taxes) for this hotel, and expected a 3-star hotel. I was very disappointed. I should've paid the extra $20 and picked Doubletree Hotel or another hotel with dependable clean standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great service; amazing beds; superb location”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: Location: I was hesitant booking this hotel based on location alone, not being in the heart of downtown. But Little Italy is a really happening place in the evenings, and seemed busier than most areas downtown at night. Service: Customer service was excellent at this hotel. Dealing with a situation in our first room; the free shuttle to the zoo; holding onto our luggage after early check-out; and answering our questions - all handled very well in a customer-oriented manner. Roof top area: There are a number of areas within the hotel, especially on the 5th floor, from which to sit down and enjoy the view. I really looked forward to my evening cigar and scotch while taking in the view of downtown, Little Italy, Coronado, the airport, and incoming planes. Rooms: Initially we were in a 'Comfy Queen' room at ground level next to the parking lot, storage, and utility areas. These rooms are small and dark. If we had stayed here the whole week, I would have given this about a 3/5 review instead of the 5/5. I'm not one to complain as you get what you pay for. But a couple of days into are stay, we woke up to dripping water. I ignored it thiking it was the shower. But it was actually a fast leak from the ceiling pouring down into the open toilet, which splashed everywhere on the floor. There was a flap of ceiling plaster that had popped open where the water was pouring from. The excellent customer service mentioned above is what led to a room change into a King-size on the top floor. Beds: In both rooms, the beds were extremely comfortable. I looked forward to sleeping every night. And we needed it after very full days of excursions, sight-seeing, shopping, and eating. Other: -I was surprised to see the work-out room. Nothing fancy, but enough to get my quick work-outs done in the evenings. -The free Wi-Fi service in the rooms is hugely appreciated. This permitted us to plan our days, map destinations, and book excursions. -I like what they've done with the style of the hotel. They've taken an old motel and turned it into something trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased...Great location, very comfortable, clean.”
Reviews.Author: goodyearchic
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how quiet the rooms were since it is near the airport. Free breakfast was delicious - high quality food and very nice dining room. Staff was very friendly. Would definitely stay here again, and recommedn to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: NHLPrincess
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was good. The hotel staff was wonderful. There is absolutley NO counter space in the bathroom....at least not in the room we stayed in. I was not expecting this to be a "motel" type property in that each room enterance was outside. I was a bit nervous at first,, but was surprised once in the room. Bathtub/shower was very slippery - could potentially be dangerous for some. Overall rating - 7 Only reason I would not stay there again is that it was a bit far from the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Free Breakfast if you book online. A little facelift would make this place awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JG104
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The lobby is really cute - small / boutique style. The rooms don't reflect this though. If you are not going to be in your room very much, this place will do. We booked online and got a free breakfast every morning, which was really good. The restaurant, like the rest of the hotel, needs some work though. The views are beautiful, but the neat lanterns that hang from the ceiling are covered in dust and paint was chipping from the chairs. The rooms and the rest of the hotel are this way too. If every room looked the way it does online, (with a large, retro photo on the wall) this place would be awesome. It was a disappointment to walk in my room and not see that. The rooftop was great. We got a drink at the restaurant and took it up there to watch the sunset over the bay. It was beautiful. The staff was pretty friendly and you can't beat the location. An overall facelift would make this place perfect. I must say, if I was planning another trip to San Diego, I would book at this hotel because the price is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: mpirate
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Diego and had to make a last minute change in our accomodations. The Porto Vista had no problem getting us a room on a Frday afternoon. The room was very clean, had a balcony, the bed was VERY comfortable and was reasonably priced. The staff made every effort to see that we were comfortable, even though there was a wedding that same weekend in the hotel. When we visit San Diego again, we will definately be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel, in a great area!”
Reviews.Author: Supertina6
Reviews.Content: I actually live in San Diego and only spent one night here. The Hotel is located in the heart of little italy. There are lots of cafes, and restaurants all within walking distance of the hotel. It is also only 1 1/2 from downtown san diego and a cab will get you there for around $5. I do have two negative things to say, number 1 it's hard to find parking on the street on weekends so the hotel offers parking but at $14. Also they ended up charging me an extra $50 even though my receipt clearly stated one price my bank account showed another. I called to have this explained to me, which did they. What bugs me is that fact that they didn't tell me that there would be a hold on my credit card, that was not appreciated. Overall the experience was nice and the beds are higher off of the ground then most and super super comfortable. Oh and the photos of the rooms are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: dburroughs76
Reviews.Content: While the Hotel itself could use a little updating and repair, it sits at the heart of Little Italy in San Diego. The murals on the walls are unique and the Customer Service is by far the best I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “This place is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dickmarticp
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was so friendly and helpful - especially Joaquim. It is in the middle of Little Italy and you wake each morning to out of this world aromas. If you're there on a Saturday be sure to go to the Farmer's Market down the street. You really get your money's worth with reasonable rates and free breakfast from their great restaurant's menu. Only slight problem was that there wasn't enough space to store your personal items in the bathroom. We will definitely return to to this warm and hip place.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice I could have made!”
Reviews.Author: sweetee_314
Reviews.Content: Celebrating my birthday I had done my research and the Porto Vista Hotel not only had a great price, but a unique atmosphere. Upon arrival, the staff exceeded all my expectations! They upgraded our room, were extremely friendly, and recommended an exquisite restaurant that turned into a fabulous club. They even went so far to hook us up with reservations just 30 min before we headed out. Had a GREAT experience! Would definitely go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: icebrg1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Porto Vista for a romantic V-Day stay. When I first read the reviews I was skeptical of it. Especially hearing that it was an old Motel 6. Because of that I decided to get a Suite thinking that at least it had to be renovated because Motel 6 doesn't have a suites. My Suite was superb. The view from my room was excellent. I decided to choose this hotel because the restaurant was on premises. The Restaurant was by far the best I had ever been in. The Staff and Management was the best and very friendly. The Food was like that you would find in any $200 a plate restaurant, but with portions that made you feel full at he end. By the end of our stay we were already planning a couples retreat. One interesting tidbit the toilet bowl had hot water, Not sure if that was a perk or a problem. I would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Really awesome hotel, with one annoying exception”
Reviews.Author: Vik_travel
Reviews.Content: I just want to get the one "negative" aspect of this hotel out of the way - which really annoyed me for this otherwise fantastic hotel. On Saturday (my first morning at the hotel), the cleaning lady knocked at my door around 9am and asked if I wanted my room serviced. I said no, as I had just woke up. She then asked me if I needed any shampoo/soap or whatever, I declined, and she left. But I didn't think that was it! My room wasn't cleaned at all for the day, since I guess they didn't bother to come back. Seriously - I don't know about other people, but 9am on a Saturday is pretty darn early to be asking someone if they want their room to be serviced. I assume housekeeping just wanted to finish their stuff early for the day or something, but it's pretty unacceptable the way this was done. Granted, it's really not a big deal in the grand scheme of things, but it just irked me that housekeeping would wake someone up early, and then not even bother to show up again. BUT - now that I've vented, there are some great things about this hotel (I swear): +Location: Right in the middle of "Little Italy", the location is pretty awesome for San Diego.
