Close to the waterfront, a 5 minute walk from the trolley (which will get you around town), and of course Little Italy is a pretty neat place in itself +Clean & spacious rooms: Other than the above, the room itself was very clean and well maintained. Clean bedding, very clean washroom and properly dusted/vacuumed. The rooms were very decent sized as well, especially the bathroom which was quite spacious +WiFi/other services: The wireless at the hotel was really strong; it seems like they have a separate network for each floor, which means a stronger signal for guests. In addition, the shuttle service was great as well - the guy who picked me up from the airport was super nice and friendly, and gave some great info/tips on San Diego. Definitely a good way to start off the trip. Unfortunately I didn't get to eat the Porto Vista, but everyone raves about their restaurant, so I think it's definitely worth checking out if you can. +Quiet: Some people mentioned that it was noisy due to the nearby airport. Personally, I didn't hear any excessive noise (and my window was open). A little tip would be to turn on the (very good) fan/AC to get some white noise while you sleep. Some other things to note: -Not a big deal, but the TV sets in the hotel room were really old and fuzzy - it seemed like I was going back in time when I turned on the TV. Granted, I probably only watched 30 minutes during my entire stay, but still something that should be updated ASAP (in my opinion) -The "motel" vibe: From the outside, the Porto Vista looks like a "hotel". But once you go up the elevator to your floor, you get more of a "motel" feel (you can check out my pics to see what I'm talking about). It's not really a big deal, and really had no impact on my stay either way, but just something to keep in mind. -The fifth floor: I stayed on the fifth floor, and it was pretty silent. However, I would point out that they seem to have a pretty large outdoor lounge/sitting area on the 5th floor, so if there's parties or whatever going on there at night, I would imagine it gets pretty loud. I'd suggest getting a room on another floor just in case. Apart from the annoyance with the housekeeping staff, this is a pretty good hotel to pick if you're in San Diego. Great location, nice staff (apart from housekeeping I guess), clean, quiet, and generally a good value (I got an amazing price on bookit.com - $55/night). This isn't a luxury hotel by any means - it's pretty no-frills, with basic amenities. But it does its job and gives you a comfortable place to rest while you're in town. Would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend, but let's just hope housekeeping is a little less "annoying" in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: calcoast75
Reviews.Content: It's very close to the airport and it had a better price than the comparable hotels in the downtown area. The free breakfast was more gourmet than the typical free hotel breakfast and the service was excellent. If I had to mention a negative, the pillow was a little too soft for my tastes, but it was easily remedied by using a towel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: etapngav
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews and location. I was very happy with the room and the friendly staff. The location was walking distance from downtown and in the center of Little Italy. The free breakfast was very good. On the weekends, the happy hour starts at noon. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: C0nky
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location in the heart of San Diego's Little Italy. The neighborhood is generally quiet and safe. Easy walk to Downtown, and waterfront. There is typically on-street parking available. Very friendly staff. By booking through the hotel, we got free breakfast each morning, which was excellent and a very nice venue. There is a large sun deck on the roof. The room was adequately sized with an extremely comfortable bed. While this hotel does not have amenities like the Marina hotels (e.g., pools, resort , etc.), this hotel is far less expensive, very comfortable, and we will stay here in future visits to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!”
Reviews.Author: ipapyrus
Reviews.Content: Our stay was pleasant! We chose it for its proximity to both the zoo and Little Italy. We did not expect the GORGEOUS view of the marina!!! It's 1 block from most of Little Italy's delightful restaurants and a 10 minute drive from the zoo. Another thing we didn't expect was a photo of a model blown up on a wall in the room. It was kind of creepy but it made sense with the rest of the hotel. Super clean room, super comfy bed (mattress was firm like we prefer--if you like soft, make sure you ask) and the staff was a joy. One quick note: no free parking. Valet was kind of pricey but it beat parking on a street that was scheduled to be swept overnight (fine or towing if parked apparently). Overall, this was an excellent stay. I plan to stay here again when we visit SD again!

Reviews.Title: “Great low-cost stay with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkeyVermont
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed in the hotel for four nights. It was in a perfect location, just a few blocks from the harbor, the Amtrak station, and a bus stop. Very easy to get around. Loved the free full breakfast and the $5 happy hour drinks. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The view from the roof was great. Free shuttle to Balboa Park, zoo, and airport. Very helpful shuttle driver. I returned home saying that San Diego was one of the friendliest cities I've ever stayed in and a lot of that had to do with the Porto Vista! Only one small thing, the motel like design of the place was a little weird--at first I felt uncomfortable with folks walking by our window but we were seldom in our room and I quickly became accustomed to it. Thank you Porto Vista!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: zonacruiser25
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel while searching for a hotel and parking for our January cruise. This hotel offered a package with a room and 7 nights parking for a great price. They have recently upgraded most rooms. Ours was clean and spacious and had new bedding. The rate included a hot breakfast for 2 in the restaurant which is also the bar. It has a nice view of San Diego harbor. The hotel also has a nice 5th floor (roof) sitting area where you can enjoy your own happy hour if you choose. The location is walking distance to Gaslamp (less than 1 mile), the harbor and in the middle of all the great dining in Little Italy. The staff was very friendly and anxious to help in any way they could. The parking was included with the room and it was enclosed valet parking with in and out privileges. We have used other hotels close to the cruises port before and Porto Vista is an exceptional value compared to most and much cleaner and more comfortable than several of the other hotels that offer similar pricing for the package. We will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but room for imporvement”
Reviews.Author: VisitinSD
Reviews.Content: Like most, I was drawn to this place by the price. It was very affordable for a lengthy stay. I stayed there 6 nights, so I got a good sense of the place. Let's start with the good: The restaurant offers an EXCELLENT breakfast that was included in the rate. Very good portions and high quality presentation; the lobby is nice and clean, and the staff was friendly; the location is GREAT, as its one block from the center of Little Italy, which is a very active area, particularly at night, and it's a relatively easy walk to get to the County Center trolley stop. Improvements needed: The TV selection sucks - I flew JetBlue and had FAR better channel selection than the hotel did; free shuttle from airport? Yeah, if you come at the right time. I got in and called for a shuttle, and was told it ends at 4:30; try as they may to masquerade it, you can still tell this was once a budget hotel, as the exterior corridors are dingy and the doors look like they just slapped a coat of paint on them. From the street, looks great; inside, less impressive. I still indicate that I would recommend this hotel to a friend, because my friends are cheapskates like me and are willing to sacrifice some amenities for an affordable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: WouldBeTraveler19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Porto Vista for one night and moved rooms twice. The first room on the 4th floor smell like cigarettes and wet spots were on the comforter which I would assume was water but I can't denied or confirm that. The comforter itself looked beat up. frayed threads and worn spots made the comforter look really old. Those weren't The reason for moving rooms was 6 teenage girls decided to rent the room next to us to celebrate a birthday party and the parents were nowhere to be found. After listening to screaming and banging for some time I decided to walk over next door and knock on the door and ask politely that the teenage girls to quiet down. The response was "we will try.." Needless to say they didn't try hard enough. I called down to the front desk explained the situation and asked if we could get a different room which they were very accommodating and switched our rooms. The second room was much cleaner and didn't smell like it was previously occupied by a chain smoker. The comforter looked new and the sheets smelled much cleaner. The constant jet landing in the nearby airport and the train horn made sleeping difficult. Also the bathroom lights did not work. I took a desk lamp plugged it into the hallway outlet. and moved it into the bathroom just so I could get some light. Apparently the wiring was messed up. When we checked out they said the reason for the lights not working in the bathroom was because it was an "eco-friendly" room and required us to swipe our key to turn on the lights but all the lights worked in the hotel except the bathroom. Plus there was no key swipe in the room at all. Room 502 had bad wiring it wasn't because it was an eco-friendly room... Some positives are -the location is great for visiting Gaslamp district, San Diego Zoo, and Balboa park. The staff is fairly friendly but may treat you like an idiot. Some people may enjoy that.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjrunner3
Reviews.Content: just driving up to the hotel was a slight disappointment, I didnt even notice it as a hotel if it wasnt for the big banner sign saying the name. it feels like a motel turned hotel, the court yard is a cement parking lot and the rooms are cramped. the furniture was wobbly and slightly broken, the tv scratched and the walls dirty. the bathroom was child size. it looked like some retro furniture to make the multicolored walls less noticeable. the pictures resemble very little of the hotel and i was so disappointed, will not stay here again. the beds and wall mural was the only nice part. the customer service could be nicer and seem more interested in your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikesanfrancisco61
Reviews.Content: I booked 5 nights at this hotel in a junior suite. The pictures on the website do not match the actual room. At checkin the clerk asked me if I had a lot of luggage as the elevator was being repaired. Luckily I had local friends with me to climb to the fifth floor. Arriving at my room we found an elevator next to the room. Also it was rainy heavy and the hotel room entrances are outside and we had to walk from the stairs across two long open walk ways. We were drenched. One, the clerk should have known about the other elevator and offered us an umbrella. Back to the room. The room was very large but the furniture and bathroom looked like an assisted living room. The room was simply ugly and not clean. I returned to the hotel later the same day and asked if there was a room available that was respresented in the web site. The clerk had no idea but throught the suites had the large bathrooms with a separate shower. I returned to the room and tried the heater. The wall heater made noise all night. The comforter was torn and looked dirty. The next morning I checked out the hotel. I moved to the Sheraton Suites. The Sherator was 1000 times better than the Porto Vista and was over $10 a night less expensive with a reward program. Warning - don't stay at this hotel! There are better options in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel,Location & Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JennyLe11
Reviews.Content: My Group & I had an great experience @ The Porto Vista Staff was very friendly & helpful The business Center was down but Front desk went extra mile to get my documents printed. We enjoyed Happy Hour @ The Glass Door Fabulous Mojitrons! Little Italy is right next door perfect Location. Complimentary Shuttle to Airport/Convention Center I would Definitly visit San Deigo again but for Vacation this time! I recommend this Hotel & I'd like to thank Leala Gonzalez for helping me coordinate my room block!

Reviews.Title: “Better then Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: jonkar154
Reviews.Content: We booked this 3 night stay after reviewing it online. There was some "iffy" comments, but I could not figure out why. Hotel was very well located; within easy access to attractions, Harbor, Airport, etc. Staff was very helpful and friendly, particularly the hotel vehicle operator. He was more then willing to assist with any reasonable request, and shared information about the area. Room "package" came with a very good breakfast in the "Glass Door" restaurant each morning (view from restaurant is extremely lovely). Many nice places to visit or eat at within easy walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An extremely friendly staff that will never disappoint you!”
Reviews.Author: Half_a_Century
Reviews.Content: We called the hotel from the airport and shortly thereafter we were picked up by the most friendly and courteous shuttle driver. As we checked in the front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful ... they were awesome... always ready to answer any question or help in whatever way they could. The staff in the dining room was amazing. The view from our room was great and the availablility to all the sites either by foot, shuttle or taxi allowed us to be always on time for our meetings each day. The area offers great food at a variety of pricing and experiences. We honestly couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Must see city”
Reviews.Author: mollybgood
Reviews.Content: Perfect weather, very friendly, helpful people, what a great experience. We stayed at the Porta Vista Hotel in Little Italy section of San Diego. It was convenient to eating and touring. They have a FREE shuttle to most of the local attractions for tourists. Shuttle to and from the airport, again FREE. Beautiful view of the harbor. The staff was very helpful, numerous times. Would stay here again tomorrow!!

Reviews.Title: “Over night”
Reviews.Author: dog245963
Reviews.Content: Our stay was not for pleasure it would have been but under the circumstances the family just needed the over night stay.Your staff was very pleasant, accomendating and courteous,we enjoyed the complimentry breakfast for two.The only concern was that the sheets weren't crisp like cleans sheets should be, I bring my on any way,TV needed some ajusting. But overall the stay was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Had I known...I would have Upgraded sooner!”
Reviews.Author: JustGiveMeTheLight
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I was attending a seminar in Downtown San Diego. From the looks of the website and the style of the hotel, I was pretty excited about my stay. It is located in a great part of town called Little Italy and it was very accessible to public transportation. I traveled late from LA to SD on a Monday and arrived at about 1 AM. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful and directed me to my room. I did not book my own room, my company did, and was very grateful for that, until I entered my new space for the next 4 days. I was given a room on the 1st floor where the view out of my window was a parking lot. The room was tiny, the sitting chair was placed in front of the closet cabinet doors (because there was no where else to put it), and the light in my bathroom did not work. Too tired to complain, I went to sleep. The next morning, I let the front desk know about the light and they had fixed it by the time I returned in the afternoon. I spent 3 more nights in this single Queen room. My friend decided to come down and visit for the weekend, so I wanted to extend my stay in San Diego. I went and asked if there were any available rooms, possibly a King, for Friday night. Luckily, there was one available (even though there were 3 wedding parties arriving), and they kindly set me up. I walked back to my little cave and decided to walk right back out and ask if a King was available right then and how much more it was. I found out it was only $15 to upgrade and began my move up to the 5th floor (the highest level). I took the elevator and, as I exited, I caught the end of a beautiful SD sunset on the ocean. The King was nearly twice the size of the queen and I had a balcony with a partial view of the ocean. The next 2 night were soooo much better (although they do need to do an upgrade on their TVs....the one in the queen didn't even have a remote control!). If I had known the size and price difference between a Queen and a King, I would have upgraded to the bigger room sooner! My stay there, all in all, was still enjoyable. The location was incredible, the prices were reasonable, and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: nicblue78
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel is in a fantastic neighborhood. We walked everywhere. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from downtown San Diego, or a $5 cab ride. -Little Italy is quaint, quiet and has tons of great restaurants. -The hotel shuttle is quick and convenient. The view of the bay from the hotel restaurant is wonderful. -The hotel staff is attentive and we received fantastic customer service our entire stay. Cons: -The inside of the hotel has a motel feel as the hallways are open to the outdoors, and they need a fresh paint job. -The rooms are small, but nicely decorated and the beds are comfortable. -The bathroom itself was a bit out of date. -We would definitely return to the hotel because of the neighborhood and great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: MarkG_LA
Reviews.Content: THE BEST HOTEL IN SAN DIEGO FOR THE RATE. The place is clean. the rooms are very nice and the bed ARE THE BEST. The staff are great and friendly. Only thing it needs is a pool. But ITS IN THE PERFECT LOCATION. The surrounding area "Little Italy" the best in San Diego. You can just go for a walk and find the best shops, FOOD and NICE BARS. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! ! !

Reviews.Title: “If I had a choice, I would not stay here”
Reviews.Author: IndieSFgirl
Reviews.Content: The service was horrible - on the website they advertise that there is a shuttle to pick you up at the airport. I called ahead to tell them my flight time, but they were disinterested, saying that I should just call when I arrive. So I did actually that, and the service staff told me that it will be 45 mins before the shuttle could come and pick me up, because there is only ONE shuttle taking people around, which I was not told so during my reservation. Also, the website makes the hotel looks really nice, but basically this is a motel-quality place. In addition, the second day when I took the shuttle service, the driver asked for $, it was not free as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: 5scheidemona
Reviews.Content: This most recent stay at Porto Vista Hotel was truly excellent. Every last detail (room, parking, dinner reservations, etc) was attended with care and professionalism. Everything was truly top-shelf, from the friendly greeting at the parking area, the check-in (the staff offered to check our bags directly to our room in since we arrived early - we accepted, of course), the room service, dinner and breakfast at the Glass Door. The first evening, the Glass Door restaurant served us an excellent light dinner (we went 'tapas' since we'd nibbled at a couple of other places earlier in the day) and a great breakfast the next morning. The views from their deck are tremendous! Even on a cold evening as ours, the heated patio was comfortable and full of people enjoying the environment. The proximity to India Street restaurants, cafes, and wine bars are another plus to this wonderful hotel, btw. Our sleep was perfect: a big warm bed in a beautiful room without any noise at all from other guests or the street. To have your fist coffee of the morning on the suite's long balcony with inspiring views of the sunrise over the marina is another definite plus! Our check-out was as seamless as our check-in. Two words: excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JoPLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the hotel. I like the vibe of it, the restaurant, great food,and the terrace (the views are great). The bed and pillows were very comfortable, but the bathroom was very small, with no room to put toiletries. The TV was old and didn't have a good picture..hint to manager..get new TV's. We stayed 2 nights and on the second day, the bed was not made, just the bedcover was straightened up, I had to remake the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lvickl53
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after seeing the photos and reading the good reviews, then realized I should have read the bad reviews to. A day before the trip, I read the reviews, and was very disappointed so I contacted the Hotel let a message with no one responding. So I went onto booking which did such a fast job I asked if they could place my partner and I in a room with clean carpet and newer side of the hotel. It's seriously like a motel. Through booking they were able to contact Ryan, and he noted on our account to put it us in the newer side of the building in a Business King Deluxe (i guess that's with the balcony), I had called early the morning of our arrival to say please don't give the room away we're arriving at 10pm, receptionist responded ok. We get there, our room was sold out so you get two queen beds. (ok there's nothing we can do now so ok we took the room) after we got the keys, we went to the room the light doesn't work on the main wall. And then there was a dirty red straw on the comforter of one of the beds. So I go back down and ask if the room was cleaned and why the light doesn't work, gave me excuses and then asked if i wanted to change my room. So I said yes please, changed to a room bigger and better, that room was ok, but the bathroom had mildew in the shower on the tiles. gross. Although the complimentary breakfast was pretty good in their restaurant on the 4th floor. weird though because through booking.com we got complimentary breakfast, and the receptionist that night gave us tickets, but as we were checking out early this morning Ryan said we didn't qualify for the breakfast. THIS PLACE IS ALL OVER THE PLACE. ridiculous the staff, the booking, i don't know what more to say but to not stay here. I read the great reviews and was so excited but really it's ridiculous. oh and the remote to my tv didn't have batteries, by then I was just too exhausted to even bother calling for a battery.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and accomodating--great food.”
Reviews.Author: kh1333
Reviews.Content: Staff at the hotel and the restaurant could not have been any nicer. The rooms were ready at check in time. We went to one of the common areas to spend time with the group and it was beautiful watching the planes come in. Next morning had a wonderful breakfast in the restaurant. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location...great holiday”
Reviews.Author: gig16
Reviews.Content: Porto Vista hotel is in such a central location for seeing the sights of San Diego. It's shuttle bus (which I wasn't aware would pick me up from the hotel had I rung them) was a bonus in visiting Sea World & Balboa Park. My room was clean, and very adequate as a base for travel. The planes were a bit annoying, they're loud and easily heard in the room - but I got use to them. Breakfast was a great bonus - and very yummy. The restaurant is a great place for a drink to enjoy the view, but the dinner prices were a bit steep for what was served. Female staff were more than helpful - males behind the front desk needed a shake up - were of little help

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Penumbra87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the suites in October. The hotel is very pleasant, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay very much. The suite costs more than a regular room by about $40/night but it was well worth it because we had a living room and a balcony overlooking the bay. It was still cheaper than most hotels in the area. The restaurant upstairs is a good deal (you pay $35 to get a $50 meal) and good food. Breakfast is free if you book online through their site. The hotel shuttle will take you pretty much everywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disregard bad reviews... This place was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: CNAO
Reviews.Content: We live here in La Jolla and I wanted to take my wife and 3 month old downtown for the Italian FESTA as well as get away for a "staycation" on our Anniversary. I read the reviews and reluctantly went with the PV to make my own opinion. Being that we are close I would have just come home if it were bad. It was the exact opposite. Very friendly staff, GREAT breakfast for FREE, and we walked all over downtown, Seaport Village, and Little Italy without a single issue. The price is surprisingly low for the location, free shuttle to Sea World and Zoo, and the food in Little Italy is superb! You only have to walk one block to get to it. The room was a King w/balcony. Plenty of room for us, the stroller, and the baby's Pack-n-Play. The fridge, microwave, and wet bar proved handy too. There is not another REAL Hotel Downtown offering so much for it's guests at this price. I will summarize by saying, make your own opinion by going here, we did and it paid off big time. GREAT PLACE and I would go again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: magooo1
Reviews.Content: The (OVER PRICED) room was very small, not like the photos on their website. I found the carpeting on the floor was ripped away from the wall and just laying there, the shower curtain was worn and frayed, TV Remote was not working (probably needed a new battery) and the wall electricial oulet in the bathroom (where you would plug something into) was loose and shifting back and forth in the wall. The ($9.00 breakfast that was included in the $106.00 room price was about half the size of a KID'S HAPPY MEAL. There was a charge to use their in house computer & NO FREE PARKING, VALET ONLY $14.00 a day. There was a parking stucture attached to the hotel that had a sign that said PARKING $7. & VALET PARKING $14 @ day. I asked if I could use the $7 @ day parking and the desk clerk told me the hotel guest are REQUIED to use the Valet Parking Only @ $14. I have requested a TOTAL REFUND. "NOT A HAPPY CAMPER"

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: LagunaBeachMarylynn
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Little Italy Festival and the hotel was very close, but the rooms are very small and old.We were on the fourth floor and a wedding reciption was going on above us. Very noisey. Then as for our free breakfast it was awful Food was cold and the potatoes were from the day before or at least they seemed that way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: kimkilkenny
Reviews.Content: When our son and Daughter-in-law decided to select PV as their wedding headquarters this past spring, we were excited because we were already fans of the Glass Door Restaurant for it's views and great munchies. It was a marvelous hotel for my 5 brothers, 5 sisters and their families to rendezvous during the weekend of festivities. The staff was extremely helpful, the breakfasts and happy hours were well staffed and the housekeeping staff took wonderful care of our entire party with extra towels and sprucing whenever we requested it! We took full advantage of the patio areas and location in the heart of Little Italy and walkable San Diego attractions and nightlife. The evening roof top reception, after the wedding, was great fun with an unparalleled view of the sunset over San Diego Bay. Did I say great staff? They were terrific. We will definitely return for quiet weekends and group functions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but noisy surroundings from the freeway behind.”
Reviews.Author: GlenB062
Reviews.Content: Very good customer service, location, breakfasts and rooms. Did have a problem with highway noise from the freeway and being a weekend, a party happening next door. Booked a shuttle to the Airport and they were 20 minutes late starting the run which left us dashing at the last minute for our plane.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: PerthAngie
Reviews.Content: We didn't begin with a fantastic impression of the hotel as we were left at the airport for an hour and a half waiting for our shuttle service. This was quicly compensated for by the driver himself. The rooms although a little outdated were made up by the fabulous location of the hotel and the complimentary shuttle service to all of the main attractions in San Diego. Althouth they don't seem to promote it overly well to guests online or when you get there, they do in fact have a complimentary shuttle that can take you, and pick up at set times to SeaWorld, Zoo, Airport, etc. This in itself makes the hotel stand alone from others and was the greatest value for our stay. The rooms are adequate and a little odd with feature portraits on the wall of each room, but it was fine as a place to base yourself. It is a good walk downtown, and only 5 minutes to the sea wall. Based in Little Italy, get ready to eat your fair share of pizza and pasta. There are only a few other non Italian options close by, otherwise go to the harbour, or catch transport to Gastown. There is also a guest lanudry that is handy, and try to get back in time for happy hour at the hotel restaurant and have a drink whilst looking at the great view of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel so far on our holiday and the most expensive”
Reviews.Author: 60750Chris
Reviews.Content: The smallest rooms in USA we think. First room dirty then changed to another but both rooms tiny. No fresh air as windows could not be opened. Didn't feel secure - the lock on bedroom door had been forced by previous guests. No fridge in room so forced to use tap water for drinking. Location a good miles walk from any nightlife/restaurants. Not at all in the centre of attractions as advertised. Didn't sleep well as could hear plumbing from neighbouring rooms, trains and planes flying low overhead. In all totally disatisfield and wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Enough”
Reviews.Author: ChilliLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Wed 15th Sept for 3 nights. I had pre-paid on expedia, but was not made aware of the valet parking, that you have to use at $14 per day, which was a little cheeky as there is no where else you can park, we were in and out a fair bit so with tips everytime they get your car your looking at an extra $30 or so. The hotel itself was nice enough, clean, comfortable rooms, and nice bathroom. We were on the top floor so had no view unless we went outside. The breakfast was really good I must say and served in a nice little restaurant with outside heated seating, this was inclusive of our cost. It is in a fairly good location, close to the airport, little Italy and about a $7 cab ride to the gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Very decieving website”
Reviews.Author: asrath
Reviews.Content: First off their website does not portray this place accurately. The website shows nice blue trendy rooms. What we received looked like a updated Super 8. When we checked in, which was after the check in time, the front desk employee made a comment under her breath about our room not being ready. She made some calls and we were handed a key and sent on our way. No explanation of anything or "Have a nice stay." When we found our room after waiting at the elevator for 10 minutes we realized it wasn't the room we reserved. It looked like an upgrade to a suite as it was much larger, but that was the only thing it had going for it. The room was large, but the furniture was mismatched and old looking. The mini fridge under the counter didn't work. All it did was flicker its light and it didn't cool at all. The sink in the "kitchenette" wobbled as it wasn't installed properly. The TV was actually a flat screen but it was way too small for the large room. The room was painted a nasty yellow color with gross green carpet. Nothing like the cool blue rooms on the website. There were numbers written on the wall that looked like they tried to scrub off, but didn't care enough to repaint. The bathroom looked like it was remodeled by a child. The tile floor was uneven, the toilet was tightened down so it also wobbled. The sink vanity was crooked on the wall and none of it lined up with the mirror or light. The tilling around the tub was a hack job and the shower was so badly installed that they had to the fill the large cracks between the wall and the surround with caulking. The bed was comfortable but the sheets weren't fitted. They just took one sheet and laid it across the bed. None of the towels matched. Some looked like old used pool towels because they had a blue tint to them. I could have sworn the website mentioned a pool when I reserved but none was found. When we checked in we received tokens for free breakfast during our stay. This was nice since there aren't many breakfast restaurants around. We ate there three days and the food got perpetually better. This isn't much of an accomplishment considering how it started, The first day we ate at 9 and all the food was cold like it had been sitting out all morning. The next day my eggs were at least warm and by the third day it was all warm. The waitress that helped us two of the days was actually very good and friendly. If it hadn't been free I would have complained. The valet prices were a little high but I didn't mind the 14 dollars a day because the parking situation in Little Italy wasn't very good. The valets were some of the best employees at the place so I didn't mind too much. The location is good if you like Italian food. Which we do. The proximity to Little Italy was great. It was just a one block walk to dinner every night and the local cafe. Mimmos and Filippi's were wonderful restaurants. The location close to the harbor, zoo, and Sea World were also pluses as those were the main attractions we wanted to see. The main thing they need to work on is their customer service. They had a couple excellent employees but overall the rest of the place needs some help. The website also needs to be truthfully updated.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, loud drunk guests, but good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jankow5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights at the end of August, with Expedia. I prepaid for the room and had the confirmation number with me. Even so, when we arrived at the hotel, they had no record of our reservation and made us wait quite a while in the lobby. The next day when we came back to the hotel after our day out, we were locked out of our room and had to wait again in the lobby while the clerk again called Expedia to confirm that we were booked for 2 nights. The first night we stayed was a Saturday and there were several noisy, drunk guests making noise and keeping us up until almost 5:00 AM! There was even one girl crying directly outside my room. There seemed to be no security or employees keeping an eye on these unruly, rude guests. The fact that the bar is directly outside of everyone's rooms, does not help matters. After we had checked out and driven a few hours, I realized I had left my cellphone charger in the wall outlet. I called that same day and was told that the desk clerks had no access to the lost and found and could not tell me anything else, even though I told them what room it was and exactly which outlet I had left it in. I called every day for the next week and was told that someone would call me back. It's been a week now and no one has called me back. The only good thing about this hotel was the complementary breakfast and the servers in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “good service, shuttles a plus. amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Bean_sunshine
Reviews.Content: stayed here while seeing the zoo and seaworld. free shuttles to both! complimentary breakfast was beyond what i expected. try the french toast! i had it every morning and cant stop thinking about it. quick walk to little Italy, great food down there good view from restaurant of the water. rooms a bit small, but we were out most of the day so just came home to crash therefore got the job done. good coffee in room and amazing in the restaurant. popular night club upstairs, so just dont get one of the top floors (as far as the reviews for noise complaints). we stayed on the 2nd and didnt hear a thing safe neighborhood too as far as i could tell. we walked every night to little italy and never felt uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Booked just for fun but would totally stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: nice2meetU
Reviews.Content: Since we were in town for a wedding without the kids, I decided to live a little on the edge and book a night at the PV. The website is a lot swankier than the actual property but I still enjoyed our room, the restaurant, and the views of the Little Italy and the bay. We got a great rate booking directly with the hotel and free breakfast, which was excellent! Afterwards we checked out the Little Italy Mercato/Farmer's Market just a few blocks down the street. It's a foodie haven to die for - Saturdays 9-3pm. There's also free morning yoga available on certain days and a rooftop bar that shuts down at midnight. We did happen to hear people making a raucus as we were trying to go to sleep but it seems they were just making their way to their rooms or something because it didn't last very long. Other than that we were able to sleep pretty soundly in the super comfy bed, which is the most important part of the hotel stay for me. For a little over $130, tax and parking included, it was the perfect experience and we'd totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “TWO STARS .... AT BEST”
Reviews.Author: schrisanderson
Reviews.Content: The Porto Vista Hotel is located in the 'Little Italy' section of San Diego, a quaint shopping and dining district. From an aerial view, the hotel is shaped like an open, square box with a separation wall down the middle, thus having two 'atriums' separated and surrounded by rooms on all sides. The lobby is attractive and the desk personnel were professional, personable and, to the extent allowed by the hotel's problems, very helpful. Two elevators are available - one extremely slow and noisy (doors needed lubricated), and the other remote and available only after climbing a flight of stairs (odd?). The hotel offered NO swimming pool, NO hottub, NO refrigerator, NO microwave, NOT even a pen or pad of paper. They took out the pool some time ago and replaced it with a meeting room that remained completely empty during our stay (no tables, no chairs, no anything). The hallways were covered with disgustingly stained carpet (except for the 5th floor concrete hallways) and lined with air conditioning units jutting out into the small hallway about 12 inches and many of these were rusting and in need of paint. The two 'atriums' did NOT overlook attractively landscaped courtyards but badly stained concrete parking areas. Parking was by valet only at a cost of $14 a day unless you wished to park on the busy street with various parking limitations. The Porto Vista is about 3 miles from the renowned San Diego Zoo and the primary reason we stayed here. There is a small rooftop viewing area that allows a nice view of the surroundings as well as the incoming and outgoing airport flights which fly overhead nearby. The beds are comfortable but squeaky, awakening sleepers in the room. The hutch and armoire dominate the small room, standing six feet tall and offering very little horizontal space and they dwarf the 21" TV. The bathroom was adequate but the ceiling was peeling and rusty in places. Upon arrival, there was a large pool of water on the sink, perhaps from a leaking faucet, and the toilet required that the handle be held down until the full flushing process was complete. Lamps had switches on cords hanging behind furniture (difficult to see or use). The rooms were austere, completely lacking decoration other than the tasteless black-and-white whole wall depiction of a movie star. The room air-conditioner was effective and moderately quiet. Every footstep of the tenant above our room was heard. Cars honked their horns in the 'atrium' outside our door and the blasts echoed and reverberated loudly. Other than the small rooftop viewing area, the remainder of the rooftop was adorned with an open area lined with attractive seating, but all of this was behind a large padlocked gate unavailable to guests except at times undetermined and unmarked (no signs explaining when it was open). The 'Glass Door', the hotel bar overlooking "Little Italy" appeared to be nice and the happy hour and dinner menus were adequate. There was NO complimentary breakfast of any sort. I was informed that because I had phoned the hotel directly and made my own reservation, I did NOT 'qualify' for any such consideration. Huh? However, this was conveyed very politely and with an apology (what the management puts their staff through amazes me). Again, the staff were always gracious, what what they have to work with is appalling. Imagine in this day and age, a lodging establishment in a major city with NO pool, NO hottub, No refrigerator, NO microwave, NO complimentary breakfast. Other negatives were the seedy-looking hallways and atriums and bland rooms. We have stayed at hundreds of hotels include the Porto Vista as one of the BOTTOM TWO hotels we've experienced. The ONLY reasons this hotel rates even the one-star is because of location and a great staff. We overheard comments of other guests, especially on the elevator, saying that they felt 'trapped in this dump', because if they left, the 24-hour cancellation policy would require the loss of one night's room cost. We inderstood. In final review, other than the excellent staff and good location, this hotel is of VERY POOR quality and we would NEVER stay here again. Thank you for allowing me to offer these observations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: annikalibby
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value in San Diego. The hotel offered a free airport shuttle for pick up and drop off, breakfast, and complimentary internet. The staff were gracious and courteous at all times, and I was able to check in upon arrival at 9am--a full six hours before the designated check in time. Breakfast was amazing, it was practically gourmet food and included in the room rate. I had rosemary potato frittata and challah french toast, for example. The rooms were cute with the retro murals painted on them, and all the comforts were available such as hairdryers, iron, and multiple reading lamps. It was spotlessly cleaned each day as well. As for the disadvantages, the first would be location. The hotel was a long way away from downtown in my opinion, and not at all close the Gaslamp Quarter. A walk to the harbor boardwalk was a good 20 minutes, and even that had few attractions. There weren't many restaurants that offered food other than Italian food as this area was considered "Little Italy" so plan to use taxis often. The free shuttle to nearby attractions was a nice touch and probably saved me $50 in cab fare over the weekend. I took it to the zoo, convention center, and marina and the driver happily picked me up from those places as well. The only problem is, as mentioned above, there is very little near the hotel and many, many people attempt to use the one hotel shuttle which seats seven. If you don't book or reserve a seat the night before, it fills up quickly. And it's often running behind schedule. The day I went to the zoo I waited in the lobby for almost 2 hours for the shuttle because I kept being told that it was five minutes away repeatedly. Then I was told that since I'd waited so long I would be first dropped off, which also ended up being not the case as we dropped other passengers off at the marine base first. So all in all I wasted 2.5 hours in San Diego when a ten minute cab ride ($7) would have gotten me there alot faster. Consider the shuttle a perk--but don't rely on it. It was the only thing I heard complaints about from our crowd. Personally, if I was management I'd consider establishing a second shuttle. So the summary is, fabulous service, excellent breakfast, and comfortable beds and pillows all at half the price of the Gaslamp Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential but fails at the basics”
Reviews.Author: Nigel1127
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to the Porto Vista. Their site made it seem like a great place. The problems started at check-in. It was busy, but one of the three front desk attendees was just going through paperwork and not assisting anyone. She was trained at the front desk job because she helped the guy that checked me in. So it's not like she couldn't have helped check folks in. I observed the other two to be rude to the people that they were checking in. Certainly no "welcome - can I help you" - lots of eye rolling. Very odd. So my first opinion wasn't great. When it was my turn, they printed out my info and the price on it was not the price that I'd gotten on their own website. I noted that in writing, showed the print-out email from THEM that I'd received, and spoke with another attendant and she said it was fixed. But the next day when I checked out, it was still wrong and another supervisor had to fix it. 5 hours after checking in, a pre-ordered item (offered on their own website) had not arrived in my room so I mentioned it when leaving for dinner. I had the print-out from the website and an email where I had corresponded with the hotel about the item. After trying to get me to do it, the front desk attendants finally said that they'd take care of it while I was out (my suggestion, not their offer to help). Upon returning to my room, it still wasn't there. Finally someone from the bar arrived with the wrong item, saying that they didn't know what I was talking about, asking me to pay double what I was quoted on their website for the wrong thing, and lots more eye-rolling. I think they must teach this at Porto Vista orientation because it runs rampant. The room was a king suite. It was a good size and the bed was very nice - slept well. But otherwise, it was pretty shabby actually - some new and some old stuff. Carpet was very shabby. The bathroom seemed nice at first glance but the toilet was wobbly, the soap dish spun around, and the shower control panel also was loose. Breakfast - very average. The toast was so hard the first time 'round that we banged it on the table when the waitress came by to show her it's rocklike features. Check out time is 11am. The maid knocked and entered at 10am thinking we were already gone. What??? Also, there was NOTHING in the room about the hotel. No info on the restaurant, what else was there, not even a pen. Communication is not the best apparently at the Porto Vista - between employees, between employees and the website, and between employees and their customers. Basically, just an odd stay. Maybe they'll get better, but for now, go elsewhere. I will say, that even though we had to pay $14 for the valet parking, the Valets WERE the most customer oriented of the bunch. They were friendly, fast, and knowledgeable about the area. We got concierge type info from them and NOT the front desk folks. All in all. It should have been MUCH better for the money. Their website seems to boast a much better place than it is. But I might be willing to accept a less than perfect building and furniture if the employees were a little more (no, they need to be MUCH more) customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Liars and Thieves”
Reviews.Author: dopo2010
Reviews.Content: My party of 6 arrived with confirmation number in hand for 3 deluxe King w/balcony rooms. We had double-checked with the hotel 3 days earlier when we started out by car and the front desk confirmed our reservation. We arrived road weary the first night and were told that they had only one of the rooms we reserved, the other two being the â€œcozy queen.â€� "Cozyâ€� is an understatement. 2 suitcases and 2 men couldnâ€™t walk around the room. One person would have to stay on the bed to let the other move to and from the bathroom. THERE IS A REASON THE ROOM PICTURE ON THE WEBSITE IS OF THE CORNER OF THE ROOM. We repeatedly asked for a manager and were told none were available in person or by telephone and concessions could not be made with out the approval of a manager. We were concerned that the last arriving couple was not going to be able to fit in such tight conditions as he was 6'4 and 270 and needed a king bed to be comfortable let alone fit his wife. Despite much pleading and complaining about how we had confirmed, we were told they couldnâ€™t accommodate. We went to the car and searched another hotel nearby that had kings and went in to cancel the reservation and magically they had a room the third part of our party could have at no additional charge. If we could just be patient and accept the upgrade to a suite, all would be made good in the morning when a manager was available to discuss concessions. The next morning we were made to feel like we were granted the privilege of having our reservations honored but no apology was forthcoming for the terrible room that we had stayed in and for having to wake up extra early to have time to deal with the hotel management. Mr. Johnson, the front desk manager, told us that we would all be comp'd the parking expenditures for the poor customer service we had received and that the third couple would be "allowed" to stay in the suite for the remainder of the stay. During the stay the rooms were not well cleaned and refreshed, one room didnâ€™t get toilet paper restocked and we had to call and get some brought to us. After 3 calls, an extra roll was donated from another room. The extra toilet paper was eventually delivered to the wrong room. The mirrors would fog from the shower and reveal pornographic images left by a previous guest; the refrigerators would not cool anything to below 57 degrees. You could not drink the complimentary coffee in the room because there were no cups in one room and only decaf another. The TV's were a different brand and size in each room, all circa 2000, no flat screens, no digital reception and the color tint function was broken in our room so we watched TV in blue and orange. Breakfast was included with the stay but if you slept past 8am there was no French toast, bacon or sausage. They bill themselves as a "Hip Hotel near Sea World | Zoo"...anyone paying attention to anything "hip" knows you better have bacon. This all culminated in a phone call from Mr. Johnson to my cell phone after leaving and 80 miles out of town telling us that it turns out since one of our party got the room they wanted, no one would be compensated for that first night and parking charges were added to two of our credit cards. DONT STAY HERE unless you want to pay good money for a renovated broken down motor lodge, right off the loud freeway, directly under the flight path of landing jets to the San Diego airport and the worst customer service. They fail to realize that itâ€™s not about the money; itâ€™s about customer service and being played by management.

Reviews.Title: “Not the right vibe.”
Reviews.Author: Medic129
Reviews.Content: I am not in the habit of writing reviews, but the Porto Vista has inspired me. First of all, the website touts a â€œsexy European styleâ€¦the Porto Vista Hotel calls to mind the cool, casual mood of the 1960â€™s Mediterranean coast.â€� Nope, not even close. It is a poorly renovated motor lodge. Cheesy wall-sized photos and colorful banners over the interior parking lot did not create that trendy retro vibe for me. Poor construction, cheap furnishings and even worse up-keep make this an unpleasant stay. The rooms smelled like mildew, there was a pile of recycling and garbage at the bottom of the dark stairwell and housekeeping was erratic at best. There was a free breakfast that was quite good, but get up very early or it will be gone. â€œSorry, we are out of bacon.â€� But the worst part of all was the customer service from the front desk. Our friends had reserved (pre-paid) 3 rooms for six people- all kings with a balcony, for which we paid extra. When we arrived, my wife and I were the only ones with the king room, the other two being very small queen-sized rooms on the interior. The night desk person did not have the capacity to make a decision without a manager but was able to find a different room for one of the couples after threatening to take our $1200 elsewhere. The next morning, one of the managers offered to our friend to comp all three roomâ€™s parking fee at $14 a day for our inconvenience, an offer that we found acceptable. When we checked out, my wife was told that there were no pending charges on our credit card and that a receipt was not necessary. Fine. Later that day our friend received a phone call from the same manager stating that he had changed his mind and that since my wife and I had received the room we had reserved, he was going to charge us for parking after all. The charge showed up on my card today. I attempted to call the general manager but his voicemail box is full and not accepting messages. I have to wonder if it is full of complaints. A call later leads us to another manager who said she would look into the problem. We will see what the outcome of that will be. It is not about the money. It is about customer service. The website lies about the quality of the hotel and the staff will lie to your face.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Spreckles1949
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the $14/day parking and having to load and unload while others waited in the street. Room was smal,l noisy, smelly and hot. A/C froze up and had to turn off. No ventilation fan in bathroom and TV remote died. Restaurant had limited and unusual meals that were expensive with no child meals. Asked for additional towels and was told to get my own from the laundry. Elevator not working for 2 days requiring climb up to second level with baby stroller to use another elevator. Front desk agreed to keep baby's milk cold and found warm the next day (threw it away).

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: marina1712
Reviews.Content: Worst place I have ever stayed in my entire life. Terrible and rude employees, dirty rooms. and horrible service. Don't even bother considering to stay here. It's a complete waste of money. They should rename it the hole, cause lets face it it pretty much is from the disgusting rooms right down to the management staff who wouldn't know customer service if it bit them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Porto Vista? We re-named it Porta- Potty”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoFanatiic
Reviews.Content: I really don't know where to start. There were so many things wrong with this hotel (motel?) that it would be hard to describe in the space i have here. Let's start with the elevator...one slow elevator to serve the entire property. Oh by the way, it won't stop on the 2nd floor or the 4th unless you hold the button. We finally figured out that if you don't mind walking past week old garbage you can take the stairs (not clearly marked and i would not recommend a woman taking then alone). Once we finally got to our floor, the carpet in the hallway was absolutely disgusting. I mean, we are talking about 30 year old carpet that has never been cleaned. DO NOT WALK BAREFOOT AROUND THIS HOTEL.. God only knows what kind of disease is in those carpets. The room itself was musty and moldy smelling, and they have window air conditioner from a decade i probably didn't live in. Amazingly, there was no vanity of any kind in the bathroom...you get to set all your toiletries on the floor because there is no where to put them. They claim to have room service, but that's just a rumour...they never actually answer the phone at the front desk. There was not a single brochure, phone book, map, hotel directory, anything, in our room. The biggest issue that i have with this fleabag is the internet pictures of the room...DON"T BELIEVE IT!! They may have one room that looks like the one on the internet, but we had 16 rooms for a wedding and not a single room looked like the one we saw on-line. To be fair, the bed was actually comfortable, and the van driver was great. Overall, what an aweful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dynamite2010
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Porto Vista and were absolutely satisfied. We had a very nice room on the 5th floor, which was clean and big enough. The bathroom was pretty huge, too. The hotel is located in Little Italy, so there a lot of good restaurants there, and Downtown and the Gaslamp District are within walking distance. Negative about this hotel: the free WiFi is extremely slow and the bathroom as a huge glass door, so you don't have any privacy, whatever you're doing, literally.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of $170.00”
Reviews.Author: JACKS25075
Reviews.Content: Seriously?? Where to begin - spending $170 and getting no parking, one (very slow) elevator to serve well over the 100+ people staying there that evening, the room had no AC and smelled like wet towels. Bedsheets reeked of bleach and returning to the hotel at 1:30 am was surreal - completely empty lobby with the sound of the front desk phone ringing and ringing....so obviously no one to think about complaining to. As a Cal native; I've stayed in everything from Motel 6 to the Ritz-Carlton and thought maybe we were having one-time bad hotel karma until we ran into complete strangers today who had the same crappy experience (they even stayed on the same floor) with one bonus: they did get parking but the rude valet took 45 minutes to pull ther car up.

Reviews.Title: “What they do have going for them, they do well.”
Reviews.Author: Dalex916
Reviews.Content: I spent the first full week of July here. I booked through hotelclub.com, and received a pretty good rate for the week. So to begin: The Pros: 1. The hotel is in a great location. Little Italy is the best, the food and environment is great. It's close to the harbor and freeway access. It never took me more than 5 minutes to get anywhere from the freeway. It's close to downtown too, and SeaWorld isn't far either. The location is the best feature of this hotel. 2. The staff is very helpful. I never had a problem asking them for anything. I didn't even know I had breakfast vouchers, but they sure did tell me! The room was cleaned each day, and there was no worry about leaving things in the room. 3. The restaurant. The Glass Door, as it's called, was good. At least the breakfast was (we ate elsewhere during the day, since we were about). It wasn't your typical hotel breakfast of juice/coffee and pastries, it was two eggs, toast, potatoes, and choice of bacon or sausage. Which I thought was nice, since there aren't many places close by for breakfast. I'm sure lunch and dinner were just as good. 4. Did I mention the location? I don't think I'll stay anywhere else but in Little Italy in San Diego. The CONS: 1. The lobby and shared areas are nice. But the actual hallways and rooms have gone through a hasty remodel. If you're really picky, you might not like that. If you're spending a lot of time in your room, you might not like that. I noticed it and we didn't spend much time in the hotel, but I got over it. The room was clean, and that's what's really important. 2. The rooms amenities. We had the basic room (so I can only comment on that) and it didn't have a fridge or microwave. Disappointing considering the amount of food the Italian restaurants nearby like to serve. The tv was pretty old, probably as old as I am(22). The bed was very firm, even for me (i like a firm bed), and the pillows weren't very comfortable. The furniture is good, but the room is small so it can get tight. 3. Valet Parking. $14 a night. It's only a problem because it should be included or at least mentioned when looking for hotels. It's not as expensive as other hotels in downtown, but it is an extra fee that can add up. I didn't mind, because it is convenient, but I think It's a bit excessive since there aren't that many people at the hotel. I strongly believe that it should be included with the fare. Conclusion: I think that for a night, this isn't a bad hotel. If your planning to spend a while hear, I'd suggest not having a car because you really won't need it. You can walk nearly everywhere worth going, and if not the public transportation is very accessible. Would I recommend this hotel? I would if it's your first time in Little Italy and you don't have a car with you. You'd have to be an avid walker. If you want to spend more time here, some people would probably like their upscale rooms, but not me. I'm going to try another hotel in the area, that is just as close and still budget friendly. It's a good hotel, that could use some upgrades and changes that would probably make it a great hotel, i.e. a better tv, better pillows, and a reduced price valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: HR-Dana
Reviews.Content: This was a fun hotel with a young energy vibe to it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My room location was initially not to my liking and they immediately changed it for me. The desk offered a sewing kit for an emergency wardrobe malfunction and was very helpful with directions. The free courtesy shuttle was a valued service taking me to the Zoo, the Convention Center and the airport. The driver was funny, knowledgeable, friendly and I'm sure he told the truth during half his stories even if I don't know which half! The shuttle is only available 8-4:30pm so early morning and evening travel is on your own. The free wifi is centrally located and could not be picked up at the end of the hall where my room was located. The front desk provided a courtesy cable so I had internet, just not wireless. The hotel is constructed with several outside hallways/breezeways looking out onto interior parking. I would suggest requesting a 2nd floor and above room. If wireless is important, make sure to ask for a room toward the front or center of the hotel. The room was nice. The bed was a bit too firm for my tastes but was fine. There are no real refrigerators in the rooms - they are more like electric coolers. Mine never did work properly and smelled of rotten fish so I only opened that door once! The dinner in the restaurant was very good but the courtesy coupon breakfast left something to be desired. For some reason the cooks could never cook my eggs to order - four days in a row. I would definitely stay again and would not let the negatives detract from booking. The hotel is right in the middle of Little Italy. It's a great location surrounded by wonderful restaurants and fun shops. It's easy to walk around the area and is only a couple blocks from the waterfront. If you are there on a Saturday, don't miss the Mercato just a few blocks away - the Little Italy Farmer's Market was great fun.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was absolutely wonderful and made our trip.”
Reviews.Author: mlewis1948
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called to ask about the weather and what to wear Jazmine was terrific. We were welcomed like we were old friends. Keith helped with our tours and was always so friendly and informative. Greg, the manage was also very helpful with suggesting places to see and go. The restaurant had a wonderful breakfast and wait staff. I just cannot say enough about how at home we felt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice People”
Reviews.Author: sussexhamster
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Location is in the heart of Little Italy, and an easy walk into the city centre or to the seafront. The bar/restaurant is on the 4th floor, with an open terrace looking over the port, and there are also rooftop terraces for guests to enjoy. Staff are friendly and attentive. Food was very good. Decor is a little quirky. The room i was in looked as if they'd started doing it up "boutique style" (huge black and white photo covering one entire wall), but the soft furnishings and bedroom furniture seemed to belong to the previous incarnation.

Reviews.Title: “terrible everything. yes they have free breakfast- but i would rather pay for my food elsewhere than eat for free here.”
Reviews.Author: jdub21Phoenix
Reviews.Content: location is pretty great. little italy is down the street and has lots of cute restaurants. cafe bellino (i don't remember the name. something like that though) was AWESOME!!!!! but everything else sucked. walls are THIN. rooms are SMALL. if you are there during the school year you will hear the crossing guard's whistle every five minutes starting at 7:30am. and garbage trucks. and airplanes. and there's a 'club' upstairs on the weekends, which you can also hear. service at the glass door, the restaurant upstairs, is cute to look at. and that's it. they had free breakfast which i am ALWAYS a fan of, cause i am kinda cheap. but the service was the worst i have EVER had! two days in a row. so it couldn't have been a fluke the first day. the food was not delicious enough for me to suffer through the idiotic wait staff that move slower and more aimlessly than my two year old. the coffee was also GROSS. asked for cutlery- and the server did not know what i was talking about. 'knife and fork' i told him. english was his first language. it took him about 20 minutes to come back with anything. and that was after i had to ask for it AGAIN. i wanted to punch everyone there. pretty much the worst hotel experience i have ever had. but one positive, we were there because my husband was running in the rock n' roll marathon. the hotel is pretty close to the starting line. and they had bananas and fruit and coffee for the racers who were staying there. at 4:00 am. that was nice. but the ONLY nice thing.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MARYPOPPINS77
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights for my parents at Porta Vista for a weekend in May 2010 for their Anniversary. Since the hotel was in downtown San Diego, there is no parking within walking distance of the hotel. They had to use the valet parking provided by the hotel. There is not a self-parking area. Here is what my parents said: We were apprehensive about parking our car at the hotel because most of the cars were double parked in really tight spots. The valet filled out a ticket noting that we did not have any damage when he originally parked it in valet. We did not use our car the entire weekend. When we checked out of the hotel, and the valet brought the car, we noticed scratches on the front of car and the paint was rubbed off. Before we got in the car, we immediately spoke with the front desk and waited for the General Manager who was not in. Before we left, we filed an incident report with the police. We called Greg, the General Manager seven times and left a message each time. He did not return our calls. We finally got a hold of him on the eighth try, and he said he had to talk to the owner. It is now the middle of June and he has still not gotten back to us. He wonâ€™t tell us who the insurance provider is or give us the hotel ownerâ€™s name. Unless you come to the hotel by bike, bus or foot, I would never recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ramon was AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: JamieTech
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent! Ramon the reservations manager was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable! He made Mary Kay Director's experience one to remember! We will be back in 2012 and are looking forward to another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: smarinergirl
Reviews.Content: The people at Porto Vista Hotel are amazing!. From making our reservations, to the guy that picked us up at the airport, to the front desk people, to the general manager... we were treated like royalty. Hotel was clean. Service was great! We are already planning our next trip down there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Shanecostamesa
Reviews.Content: First off, a few caveats, yes, this is a spruced-up motel, but that being said, this place is a great value and is a good alternative to pricier hotels. We chose to stay in Little Italy intentionally and this place could not be any closer (one block) to the main shopping/eating area in Little Italy. This hotel has a surprisingly good restaurant (with a nice view to boot). Breakfast was included in our room rate, which I was not aware of until we checked in. High speed wireless internet is also free. The management did a pretty decent job making this feel like more than a motel and added character and charm where they could. Sleep quality is the area where this hotel gets points docked - if you listen hard you can hear the planes flying overhead (it's nearly under the SD Airport's flight path), although our room was fairly well sound proofed. The strange layout of the underground parking structure also means you may occasionally hear the car alarm or stereo systems reverberating during day or early evening. Probably best to try and get a room on the 3rd or 4th level. Still, I would recommend this place and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great. The rooms were nice and clean. Great Decor. The sundeck on top of the hotel was great. The valet parking was ok, but it took a while to get our car especially near checkout time. The restaurant on site had over priced food and breakfast took almost an hour. Great views of the harbor from the restaurant, but we ate at better places throughout san diego. Little Italy is a few minutes walk away, highly recommended. The front desk personnel were extremely nice and helpful. We attended a NYE party there and it was OK except for the fact it was kind of disorganized. They have their act together as a hotel, but they are far from being experts in the party/service business. Close location to airport and san diego trolley system.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: otho1487
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week. The rooms were clean and very functional. Nice efficient restaurant and bar on site. We enjoyed the locations access to most of San Diego, especially the number of good restaurants within walking distance. The staff was great! Yes, we would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: foreverliz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Porto Vista Hotel and Suites with my boyfriend for 2 nights in March 2010, as part of a longer fly-drive holiday. Location - the best thing about this hotel is the location, right on the doorstep of Little Italy with some great bars and restaurants nearby. I particularly recommend Mimmo's Italian Village, delicious food at great prices, and the inside is modelled to look like an Italian village! The hotel is only a 15-20 minute walk to the Gaslamp Quarter and Horton Plaza, and the area felt very safe at night. Room - When I first arrived at the hotel I was surprised to see that the majority of the rooms overlook a covered (but open air) courtyard in true motel style. The only window looked out into the corridor 'outside', but because the courtyard was covered (roof but no walls) there was hardly any natural light in the room. Because of this it felt slightly dingy, and the bathroom was particularly dark. Despite this the room was spacious, the shower was great, and the coffee making facilities were very much appreciated - please note that the coffee comes in it's own filter, like a big tea bag, so don't think you can't use it because there aren't any filter papers! I did like that the sink was in it's own unit outside the bathroom so that one person could use it while another was in the bathroom, and there was also a hairdryer. Facilities - The Glass Door restaurant and bar was great, it serves a variety of drinks and cocktails and has a fantastic view of the city, both during the night and day. We didn't eat there, but it seemed very popular with diners. We know there was a spa at the hotel, but we didn't have an information pack in our hotel with information about the location or opening times and we didn't get round to trying to find it. The wi-fi didn't work in our room, we had to go down to reception to use it. Staff - The staff were both excellent and miserable, depending who was on duty! Our room key didn't work on three separate occasions which was annoying, and the reception staff didn't seem surprised by this, as if it happens all the time. Local area - San Diego itself is amazing, and I would recommend it to anyone! I particularly enjoyed the Old Town Trolley Tour, which has a stop a 2 minute walk from the hotel, as it was a great way to see Old Town, Horton Plaza, Ferry Embacardo and Coronado all in one day. We weren't planning on going over to Coronado before we did the tour but I'm so glad we did - fantastic views both of the city from the Ferry Embacardo, and of the beach/sea from the bar on the terrace of the Hotel Del Coronado. Overall, this hotel is great if you're on a budget like we were, as the negatives are well worth the low price tag and fantastic views from the restaurant. If however you're looking for somewhere particularly elegant or romantic, then I'd look somewhere else. Little Italy was a fantastic area though, and had far more of a community feel than somewhere like Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Little Italy!”
Reviews.Author: rose in woods
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and the neighborhood. It was an easy walk to the shopping area and the port area. This was truly a neighborhood type hotel and lots of great Italian food and artsy shops. We were on the 2nd floor and would have liked something higher as we were almost street level and could not leave our balcony door open at night. The view from the top floor was great! The hotel is in the airport flight path,but no noise at night and did not bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about this hotel is the FREE INTERNET”
Reviews.Author: mistypink77
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby led me to believe that I'd have a nice stay at the hotel, but the room was small. Towels were gross. Stained carpet. NO jacuzzi/hot tub. The rooftop deck is actually quite nice, but they close it pretty early and there's no sign displaying the hours that it is open. They claim to have yoga everyday, but it's really only every other day at 9am. When we checked in they didn't bother to give us our complimentary breakfast passes and we completely forgot until our second day there. The staff is NOT very helpful or friendly and lastly there was dog poop in the elevator when I left that dump. Honestly the best thing about the hotel is the free access to internet anywhere within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shar0nD
Reviews.Content: We had a room with balcony and views over the harbour. Excellent location for getting around San Diego. We ate in the rooftop lounge twice and both times the food was excellent. The bar and restaurant staff were very friendly and informative. Would definately book this hotel the next time I go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel situated in the middle of...”
Reviews.Author: pdkatsea
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel situated in the middle of little Italy.the rooms are cosy but very comfy and the bar on the 4th floor overlooking the harbour was a great spot to chill out in.the staff were extremely helpful and sorted us out with a free bus ride to the zoo.my girlfriend and I really enjoyed our 2 nights here

Reviews.Title: “Modern feel in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: Campngab
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service @ front desk. Our room was decent. They had recently remodeled and clearly didn't have time to do all the finish work. There was paint on the tile in the bathroom & carpet, unfinished baseboards, etc. Nothing that didn't make the place acceptable, just not what you expect, especially after seeing the lobby. Room was quiet, bed was comfortable, and bathroom was awkwardly large yet no counter space to set make-up, blow dryer, etc. PROS: The location of the hotel is excellent. Aside from being minutes from the San Diego International Airport, you can easily stroll 4-5 blocks west to the pier and see the many attractions or go one block west to the main strip of Little Italy where you will find pizza heaven @ Filippi's Pizza Grotto. The hotel offered free yoga classes on the roof deck - a very cool little area they host special events at when they're not using it as a yoga shack. The hotel also has a hip restaurant/bar with unbelievable views from the 5th floor balcony. Sunsets from the balcony are gorgeous. CON: Not quite finished room with cheap furnishings. Poorly designed bathroom with no counter space. Pay to park - albeit considerably less than surrounding hotels. And finally - my biggest issue was the sewer vents that are piped right next to the elevators, so every time you get on/off the elevator, you're greeted with the lovely smell of a sewer plant - YUCK! A simple carbon filter could solve their problems, which may be remedied by now. Overall, a nice hotel if you get a respectible price, which we did via the internet.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed given the prior reviews”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: The Porto vista is really a revamped motel, and not really deserving of a full three stars. Mind you, it is not bad, and I would not recommend against staying there, but it just was not as good as I was expecting given many of the prior reviews. First, check-in took a bit long for two reasons: 1. There was only one person working the desk, and 2. The software that makes the key was not working correctly. The guy did finally get us keys, but it took a bit. The room itself was o.k.. A bit on the old side, and opened up on the courtyard/parking lot, and would be viewed as similar to a 1960's motel. The location is good... right by Little Italy and near the airport. Sadly, their shuttle only runs from 8-5. Bottom line, I would neither recommend or warn people off from this hotel.
