Reviews.Title: “well-meaning, but ineffective staff”
Reviews.Author: travelerx1y2z3
Reviews.Content: I experienced check-in hell at the Porto Vista. When checking in, the desk clerk said there was a problem with creating the room keys. She took me up to my room and used a pass key to let me in. First disappointment, was that the internet wasn't working and when I called the front desk, they said it was only working in the lobby. When I later went down (a ride in the slow, small elevator), she gave me my keys. Up to the room, only to find the keys didn't work. Then down, to the lobby and the valet came up with me and he couldn't get the key to work. Down to the lobby again and agreement that they would move me to another room. I was going out, so decided to do the move upon my return. When I came back, I asked for the new room keys. Went to the room, and it was a mess. Came down to the front desk and they said the computer indicated the room was clean. So, change to another room. This 3rd room was clean, the key worked, and even the internet was working. Throughout this the staff was friendly, but did not appear to know what was going on, and I got the feeling they didn't know how to run the hotel. The room was adequate. The decor tries to be hip, but seems just cheap. More importantly, its clear the renovation of an older motel was done way too cheaply and they are understaffed. For the money, this was not a good value. The location in Little Italy is good, but next time I'll find another place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Fun location”
Reviews.Author: javfun
Reviews.Content: The hotel's contemporary style and trendy/casual atmosphere, will appeal to the younger crowd. Comfortable with no big frills, and located within walking distance of Little Italy's great restaurants and bars. Has a great view from the top terrace, but on a busy day getting up there; can be a challenge with two slow elevators, and no main stair. Additional charge for parking, overall a good deal If priced reasonably; I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: achilles734
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right in the heart of Little Italy. Be aware that a major highway runs nearby, so there is some road noise (but this will be true of most Little italy hotels). While this is not a surprise in a big city, it was a bit annoying that we could not leave the balcony door open at night due to the road noise. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable- the 2 most important factors for me! We upgraded to the 'room with a view' package and it was well worth it. For only a few extra $'s, you get on site valet parking, breakfast and a balcony room. You do not get a choice from the breakfast menu with this package (eggs, toast, potatoes, coffee), but the food is good and the few extra $'s is a great value. The front desk and valet staff were great. The restaurant staff could use some help- we ate breakfast 2 mornings with only a couple other people in the restaurant. Both waitresses seemed quite stressed as if they were very busy and we actually felt like we annoyed them by being there. If you are looking for a stylish, non chain hotel in a great San Diego neighborhood at a reasonable rate then go for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: kirbyfredstpaul
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because the location looked good and I found a good price on-line. It turned out to be the perfect spot for me. The hotel's location is great; easy walk to downtown, and Little Italy's shops, cafes and markets are right out your door. Little Italy is a real gem, a fun area to reside in. At check in, I was offered an upgrade to a larger room, free of charge. During the week, hotel staff were kind and responsive (ie., "where's the blow dryer?" -they quickly delivered it to my door). Restaurant is nice, convenient, offers daily happy hour w/great views of skyline/ocean, and above-average food. As a woman travelling solo, I always felt safe in this neighborhood, day or nite. I did lots of walking around, by myself... Enjoyed the area. When I return to SanDiego, I'll re-book at Porto Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JamesYucaipa
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. Although the rooms weren't super fancy, they were clean and adequate. We had a great view of the harbor and LIttle Italy. Great location right across the street from one of my favorite restaurants, "Fillipi's." The highlight of the trip was the Food and Beverage Manager, "Darien Israel." She was terrific getting us a late check out and seating us at a perfect location at the restaurant with a super view of the harbor. Try the french toast, I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: paprika_pm
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Nice personel. Fair rates and great wafless at "the glass door"

Reviews.Title: “This was a great suprise in a beautiful package!”
Reviews.Author: FLCHICK_10
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Sandiego from Tampa for a highschool girlfriend get together ( we were from Mi and FL) this hotel has an awesome staff, Mitch, Robert, Jerald, Rebecca, Mike(bartender) Nick ( bartender) and Taylor ( bartender) sorry if I left anyone out. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and loved the views from our rooftop balcony. The food and drinks were served graciously at the Glass Door and we never went without excellent service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family and the price was superb. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: brucezdc
Reviews.Content: Throw out everything you've read about The Porto Vista Hotel because the review I'm writing will be spot on and give you the most insight on the property. My girlfriend and I decided to get away for one night, it was a last second decision. We booked a two-room suite with a balcony on their website. We were a little hesitant because of some of the negative reviews we read about, but we decided to give it a chance. We arrived on a Saturday morning and the person working valet was very welcoming, couldn't have been a nicer guy. We went to check-in but the person at the front desk had trouble finding my reservation. This was probably the only sour part of my whole experience. But since I travel a lot, I always bring my confirmation number with me. Once I gave him my the number, he was able to locate my reservation. The person at the front desk said that they have a suite ready for me but if I wanted to wait an hour, I could get a suite on a higher floor which means we'd have a better view of the city/harbor. My girlfriend and I were delighted by the option and agreed to wait. They overheard us talking about where to get lunch in the area and they quickly suggested their restaurant on the 4th floor called The Glass Door. We got there in time for brunch and the food was amazing. It was so good that we ended up going back to the restaurant later that evening for dinner!!! You have to check out the restaurant if you're ever staying at the hotel or in the area. It has great food, great staff, nicely poured drinks and a romatic view. The suite was a little smaller than I expected, but it was plenty of room for two people. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, the lighting was perfect, the balcony view was great, bathroom was neat and everything just seemed great. One of the best things about Porto is it's location. My girlfriend and I never had to use our car while we were there. Everything we needed was within walking distance. Just right down the street is Little Italy where you can find great Italian food and shops. We went downtown and it only cost us an $8 cab ride. The bottom line is this... The Porto Vista Hotel is a great place to getaway with your boyfriend/girlfriend/husband/wife. It's in a quiet part of the city, but seriously close to a lot of great places. I really don't have any complaints with the hotel. The best gesture they made was pushing my check-out time to a later time TWICE. I called once the night before and they gave me a 12:00pm check-out time. I called again the next morning and asked for an even later time and they pushed it back to 1:00pm. That really said a lot about the staff and how much they're aiming to please their guests. Trust me, take it from me, someone who travels a lot. Most hotels will turn you down if you try suggesting a late check-out twice. I've even burned turned down before the first time I've asked at some places. This place is almost perfect. Only thing holding it back was the size of the suite and it did not have room service, but that's not going to prevent me from ever going back. My girlfriend and I are already talking about going back in a couple of weeks because we had such an enjoyable experience. YOU HAVE TO GO!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - A Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghSp0rtsFan
Reviews.Content: Fantastic is all We can say about this hotel. The location is great. Located in the heart of Little Italy, its within walking distance to dozens of eclectic local restaurants, shops and art galleries. You can even catch the Trolley that tours the city only a few blocks again. It is only 2 miles from San Diego International Airport. Its minutes from Sea World, the San Diego Zoo, Balboa Park, the Convention Center and the cruise terminal. It also has a stunning rooftop terrace with views of San Diego Bay. Our room was awesome. Very clean, with king size bed, a couch and a wonderful spa tub and separate shower with marble floor in the bathroom. There was a bar and refrigerator in the room and the VIEW was incredible. We were on the 3rd floor, corner room overlooking the Harbor. It felt like we were in the Carribbean. Grace, the Guest Service Manager was so helpful and friendly. Gregg, the General Manger was also so friendly and answer all our question and provided places to see and things to do. We enjoyed the Happy Hour and the wonderful food (the chef was super) of the Glass Door Restaurant. The wait staff was so friendly and professional and courteous. My husband Dan and I can't wait to come back. We are from Pittsburgh and we have our share of gloomy, rainy days. The weather is San Diego was perfect â€“ they tell us it only rains there 5 days a year so we can't wait until we see our friends again at the Porto Vista. This is a gem in San Diego. A must stay. We would rate it 5 stars. AND THE RATES ARE SO REASONABLE Bev and Dan from Pittsburgh, PA October, 2009

Reviews.Title: “Diamond off the Beat'n Path”
Reviews.Author: IrishLady77
Reviews.Content: I was in SD for a conference w/ some colleagues. Was very happy w/ everything having to do the w/ this property. It was a bit off the beat'n path but didn't mind. Was quiet, clean and an excellent price. Has a great lil restaurant/bar - good prices. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: SRF1
Reviews.Content: The Porto Vista Hotel is located downtown in Little Italy right near the Gaslamp District which makes it convenient for an early evening stroll to shops and restaurants. However donâ€™t eat out anywhere until you try the Glass Door Restaurant that is located on the 4th floor with great views of San Diego Harbor overlooking the passing cruise ships and aircraft carriers. Be sure to get there for about happy hour time when the sun is setting, WOW, spectacular. The free airport shuttle and free wifi is important for me when doing business in San Diego or anywhere for that matter. The rooms have recently been renovated and I love the mural on the wall. I found the Porto Vista Hotel through a business colleague who raved about the service and location. He invited a several of us out for a drink at the Glass Door Restaurant during the sunset hours with the amazing views of San Diego Harbor and from that moment on I stay nowhere else in San Diego but at the Porto Vista Hotel! I plan on bring my family on my next trip since the Porto Vista has suites large enough to accommodate my family all together plus the hotel is near Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Legoland and the Harbor. I highly recommend the Porto Vista Hotel for anyone traveling on business or pleasure convenient to all the attractions and happening places of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel for the Price Point! Fab Service”
Reviews.Author: gringainMexico
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this little hotel. I paid $98.00 per night in Little Italy, which is fabulous. The hotel staff was very nice and the room was lovely for the price. It seemed underpriced to me. It would have been nice to have a microwave, there was a spot for one, but overall, it was great. I was traveling with my dog and other hotels either wouldn't take them or wanted a per-night fee for him. I think I paid $10.00 for the stay for having a pet. I made my reservation directly on their website and got a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: BPolly
Reviews.Content: Walked to everything - Gaslamp, USS Midway, Seaport Village, etc, although the nearby trolley stop would save some steps - $5 for all day pass. The hotel offers free shuttle to airport, zoo, and other attractions. Right in Little Italy, there was no need to go elsewhere for food/entertainment. Check out the Saturday street market - Yum! Our room was great except for the noise of the nearby airport, however with the doors closed it was quiet. Very comfy bed. Fridge, wetbar and microwave was convenient. Big spa-like bathroom. Rooftop cabanas were lovely - check out "Wooftop Friday nights" where you can take your 4 legged friend for a play and have a drink with friends while enjoying the view of the harbour. Best aspect of the hotel, however, is the staff. Very warm, friendly and welcoming. Thanks, gang!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: rossanator
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights at the Porto Vista Hotel. We thought the location was fantastic; easily within walking distance to most attractions. We were able to walk through the gaslamp district and then head to a baseball game. I thought the location was plenty safe to walk at night but we decided to take a cab back to the hotel from Petco Park because it was getting late. The rooms were comfortable but definitely felt old and the air conditioner did not work too well. They changed their parking policy to valet only after I reserved my room; I feel that I should have been contacted instead of being surprised at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: annacesara
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel during along trip in usa this summer and I must say I found it expensive compared to the service offered but not at all bad. we had a double queen room, clean enogth, without view but quiet. the resturant is good but expensive (I am italian, so I am quite used to expensive good restaurants, and this definetly will never survive in Italy, but compared to american standards is ok) but I must say that i saw one of the most amazing susets I ever experienced form the terrace! all in all I can say I will recommend it to friends except for the rates......

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: iheartstuff
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views of the city. Great location in Little Italy. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The Glass Door had a great happy hour and decent breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well, its eh...”
Reviews.Author: cheaptravelbug
Reviews.Content: We were driving past Little Italy and found this hotel at the last minute for $95/night, one night. At first I thought I was getting a deal (since it was a last minute) because its in Little Italy and the lobby looked promising. Well the lobby and the rest of the hotel/motel are two separate entities. First, it really looks like a motel. The room itself was OK, obviously they attempted to renovate and give the place a face lift. But I REALLY didn't like the fact that anyone could easily just pop open the window or kick down the door since the hallway was very narrow with high traffic. Inside of the room was bearable, somewhat clean and presentable, I probably wouldn't want to swim in the pool, and it really felt like being in a motel. San Diego is expensive but I could've easily stayed at a business motel/inn for the same price or for $10 more and be more comfortable. The ONLY attraction to the motel/hotel is really the bar with an amazing view of the city. I wouldn't stay here again, but may go to the bar just to soak in the view.

Reviews.Title: “Bit more investment needed behind the facade”
Reviews.Author: Paul113
Reviews.Content: The good points of this hotel are the ritzy lobby and dining area with views on the 4th floor, but the bedrooms are in need of a makeover, the a/c units do gently leak onto the carpeted walkway, the elevators need some work and the courtyard centre of the hotel is not the most beautiful in the world. Pool is a tub. We got a decent price and the location in 'Little Italy' is great, so would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: castre123
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers who say that this is a glorified motel. The rooms are very small. They are about the size of a cheap motel. The bathroom on my last cruise was bigger than this one. The airconditioner in the first room didn't work so we asked them to switch us to another room. For some reason the jacuzzi was only full of water on the weekend. They emptied it Sunday night. I suspect it's because there are so few guests here mid-week. It's disappointing, however, to not be able to enjoy the amenities that the hotel is supposed to have. On the positive side, the restaurant, although small, has a great view and there is a beautiful seating area on the roof. Like the jacuzzi, they chained up access to the seating area on the roof after the weekend so that no one can enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “A bad start and even worse ending!”
Reviews.Author: MelPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation through there own website and down loaded the driving instructions from La to the hotel in Sa Diego. I was very pissed after looking for Hawthorne Street as I drove throught SD on the main highway, going 13 miles past the downtown area to call the hotel and be told the driving directions on there web site were in error. When I finally found the hotel, the front desk acknoledged the error on there site and were amused at my anger. They said management had been told about the error by many guests but it was not yet corrected. I then was told they just switched to only valet parking in there garage and there was no parking allowed on the street. I went up to the room, which was not very nice. To turn on the A/C I had to go down on my knees since they had installed a window A/C unit at floor level that had it's control panel on the lower corner. Stupid! Rugs were dirty; toilet seat was broken; shower head was broken; no stopper in the sink which was located in the room; more furniture than the room could accomidate, but no closet. You had a mid sized wardrobe in which even my shirts were to long. Just strange and I had to pay a double rate because they were sold out the first of two nights. Guest computer access at $.50 cents a minute for a boarding pass. No comp breakfast or anything else included in the rate. I tried to check out this hotel on Trip Advisor before booking, but could not find it listed, to my regreat. I had no apoligy upon checkout and was glad to leave. Mel Heifetz

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Lybi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time and would recommend it to friends and return. The staff was excellent. It is close to downtown San Diego and the trolley and we never took our car out of the garage the whole time we were there. We had a problem with our refrigerator and they sent someone up within 30 minutes to fix it. We found the room extremely comfortable and the view from the restaurant was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience - Do not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: sftrip111
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. The staff is rude and the accommodations are unacceptable - they checked me into a smoking room when I requested non-smoking and told me to "smell which was more tolerable." The second night, the sewer backed up into my bathtub and the staff refused to help until the next morning. This alone was a health hazard and I had to find another hotel on my own (during a convention) at 2 am. I will never stay here again and demanded a full refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: smallcatoh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Little Italy and is only 1 mile from downtown. They have really nice rooms and the staff was amazing. They have a shuttle that will pick you up at the airport and will take you virtually anywhere. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “O-k hotel”
Reviews.Author: kengyen
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the other users who said this is pretty much a motel. Very convenient to Little Italy. 20 minute walk to the convention center. It seems recently renovated but I think they only renovated the lobby and restaurant and just gave the rest of the hotel a new paint job? They were able to accommodate requests- non smoking, late check out, higher floor/away from street construction - so that was nice. Just a few annoying things. We were in town for a convention. When we checked in they knew that's why we were in town but didn't tell us they had a shuttle. Next day found out they did and that we needed a reservation. Reserved a spot the day after. Still didn't get on because people were late to the one before and therefore took our space on our reservation. So not sure what the point is of the reservation? Also we were supposed to get free parking that I forgot about until our third night of street parking. They said I should have reminded them. Lesson learned on my end. But still frustrating. The room was kinda small - European hotel room small. Not sure comforter was washed. Could have just been the fabric? The tub drain was slow. I know it's a little silly but the two toilet paper rolls were almost gone and housekeeping didn't seem to care about replacing them. We had dessert at the hotel restaurant The Glass Door. The view Is really pretty since it's on the top floor. My bread pudding dessert was dry and overheated? My husband said his cheesecake was good. Overall the experience was o-k.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room, Customer Service For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: hannahbannana
Reviews.Content: After reading previous rants/reviews, here's what I got: Yes, it's a fixed up motel. We stayed 4th of July Weekend. I saw on the hotel website about the parking so I was aware, paid vallet or street parking only. The customer service was unbeatable- the house keeping needs some more training (our room was only half-serviced the second day). Our room was beautiful and very clean (when we checked in)- King, balcony, city/bay view. The elevator in the lobby was painfully slow, and no one mentioned there was a second elevator until our last day. The resturant food was 4 out of 5 (but very busy for the holiday). I was disappointed that the surrounding neighborhood closes down by 10:30pm on Friday and Saturday night. but over all, For Little Italy San Diego on a Holiday weekend, I am more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches, Toenails, & Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cabojohnny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel (glorified motel) for 3 nights July 9th,10,11, 2009. this was the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed. The pictures on the website are decieving. They lobby is very nice, as is the Bar / Patio & restaurant area. ...but the rooms are not vaccumed, there was toenails & dental floss found on the floor when we checked in. Their are tags still on furniture that was bought at collections etc. Paint was spattered on the door jams from a lack of masking. Furniture was dinged up and dirty. AND....to top it all of i had a COCKROACH run across my floor & into the bathroom, where I had to squash it. I called down to the lobby only for them to say it was most likely a water bug. I had to request twice for it to be cleaned up, then was told it was a COCKROACH. I asked for some money off of my room for all this trouble & being so dirty. I was told they could not do that since I booked & pre paid with expedia. All in all I give this room 1 out of 5. My sister and brother in law stayed the same nights in a different room, the room was just as dirty (no cockroach) but they had the extra bonus of not having the A/C work in the room. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! Look for some place else that is nicer for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: ValGal7
Reviews.Content: All the staff were great-very friendly and helpful- You can walk anywhere- So close to everything~ The elevator was very slow~ so if i didn't feel like waiting~ I just used the stairs and got some great exercise~ I was on the 5th floor and I liked my room~It was fun watching the planes fly by- when my window was closed it was very quiet! They used Bath and Body Works for their Soaps and Shampoo's- very nice- The restaurant (The Glass Door) had a wonderful view and was a fun place to people watch and see the sunset! The "happy hour" was terrific- delicious food!!! Loved the Kobe sliders and the cheese plate- The restaurant staff were all friendly with excellent service~ Fun place- I look forward to staying there again when i am in town~

Reviews.Title: “dressed up motel”
Reviews.Author: bom2535
Reviews.Content: There seem to be two types of room, double queen bed which is just about right proportioned (furniture:room ratio) and king bed with smaller room, and that was what I stayed, furnitures & fixtures are obviously too large for the room and very little space left even for only one person. Something always blocking my way so moved it or moved around. This is upgraded property from the old motel, and it is still pretty much a motel no matter how you look, a nicer & newer kind of motel room may be. Almost everything in the room looked reasonably new and modern, only exception was TV which was last decade leftover. Stayed on 5th floor, only one elevator serving so this was everyday problem, slow and inadequate. Also there is open air penthouse bar on the 5th, not far away from the room so this could be noisy and no privacy. (there are corridor window which everyone kept them shut) , hotel is very near the landing path of nearby airport so it could be noisy at time. few sea view room on the 5th or 4th should be among the first choice. Staff were helpful and friendly, boutique style lobby was attractive and nice but has nothing to do nor correlation with how the room looked. Location is near little Italy as everyone said but there are also many other choices at the same price. Parking is potential problem whenever occupancy hits 60% plus. Shuttle service available to the airport and zoo,etc. looked nice but didn't use so cannot comment. Overall this is unique, if you want to try to stay in modern/very clean motel then this should be good. The rate we've got at the time of stay was not very attractive so might not come back as said, there are many other choices...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WEGO2
Reviews.Content: Room 130 was on the 1st floor so of course somebody upstairs sounded like they were preparing for the marathon the next day, back and forth throughout the early part of the night! The room was small, but it was very nice and clean and comfortable. It appears though that other rooms in this hotel could be extremely nice. We just booked too late to see those! The staff was very helpful. This hotel is within walking distance to Little Italy in San Diego. Lots of great shopping and FOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: jkshibley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while spending the weekend in San Diego. It appears to be one of those hotels where they have spent all the money on the lobby and none on the rooms. Firstly the door did not close properly and despite the double locks on the door we felt the need to push a chair up against it over night. Also the room was basic with worn down sheets. The final thing was that the toilettries were half used by, I assume, the previous guests! The location however was good one block from the restaurants, bars and coffee shops of Little Italy. The sea could be seen from the hotel and it was two blocks from the harbour. We drove the 5min drive to the Gaslamp district which was easy to park in . Felt safe walking around late at night although San Diego does have a lot of homeless people, but if you are polite they give you no problem.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: AZcartrip
Reviews.Content: We booked a king room with a balcony. It was a great room. No extreme noises. Everything was spotless. The room had a frig and microwave with an in room safe, which we liked since we get tired of lugging all of our cameras, etc. around all the time. Being in Little Italy, the restuarants were great. The shuttle service to and from the zoo and balboa park were free and easy. The staff at this hotel were very efficient and pleasant. We recomend leaving your vehicle in their garage and taking the trolley and buses. You can cover a lot using public transportation. Overall, we had a great stay and would stay again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: j1952
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous about our stay after reading some previous negative reviews, but our experience was all positive. Our location in Little Italy couldn't have been better. Many wonderful restaurants within walking distance. Every day we stayed(9 in all) we saw evidence of constant upgrading(fresh paint,etc.).The staff was very friendly, the available shuttle service was a nice touch. Our room(408) had plenty of room in the bath . We did not have any trouble with the parking but could see it might become an issue when the hotel is busier.

Reviews.Title: “It could become loud”
Reviews.Author: busybine
Reviews.Content: There is a hip restaurant and a roof top bar in the hotel. All rooms have outdoor access (like a motel); therefore it can become loud when the weather is good and people party on the rooftop. Good for party people but not recommended for business. All rooms are traditional furnished not was the outside (hallway, restaurant) indicate. Bedding was itchy (hopefully no bed bugs); soap etc. smelled cheap and artificial. Airplane noise was bothering me. Staff was extremely friendly and attractive looking. The view is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyTravelseed
Reviews.Content: While the Porto Vista is nicely situated in Little Italy, near downtown, and the appointments of rooms are quite nice, the owner and staff of this rehabbed Motel 6 seem only to have impressions of what it means to run a hotel properly. I stayed from March 5-8, 2009, and, although I specifically asked for a quiet room on two nights out of three I was awakened and kept awake by a radio the other side of a paper thin wall, left on by uncaring, oafish neighbors who weren't in the room - they'd left a hip-hop station on. (BTW, you'd better be into threesomes cause any "business" that might be being attended to in the next room will involve you, like it or not.) I called down to the desk in the wee hours of March 7, and the clerk came and dealt with it. Couldn't get back to sleep,. though, and the next day was ruined. The same thing happened the next night and all they could do about it was move me at 2:00 am from my room - or i could stay with the radio now blaring. (The couple was present in the next room, but apparently passed out and unresponsive.) This was penalizing me for being a good guest and rewarding the bad ones. Very, very poor indeed. Next day: completely ruined. The hotel restaurant is a joke, at least for lunch. On Saturday and Sunday, you can't get any lunch - even a sandwich - only brunch. And not very good brunch, but at quite high prices, at that. It is very small and the staff really doesn't know what service is. Parking by the way is also be a nightmare: it's first come, first served in the very cramped underground spaces. If your lucky enough to get a space, you'd better think a lot about moving your car, since you won't get one later. (Check your car afterword for dents.) Indeed, it appears that the watchword for the staff is "friendliness" and that's a good thing. However, being overly friendly is not enough. "Friendly" only goes so far to make the guest comfortable and happy - the basic aim of any hotel. The management should take a lesson from successful hotels, get its act together and get its staff to hotel school. I stayed because a relative recommended it and, never having stayed there, he knew it only for what it seemed to be. What it "seems" to be is certainly NOT what it is. DONT STAY HERE. There are other, better hotels in SD that actually know how to see to business.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money..”
Reviews.Author: ld1244
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here for business trip. Upgraded hotel, at least that's what the lobby tells you. The room was somewhat small, but nicely furnished, upgraded, very comfortable. Large Bathroom. Free Internet. $5 parking fee should have been complimentary. No continental breakfast as previously advertised. In house restaurant upper floor with great view. Had breakfast there, and it was fine. One downside: Airplane and train noise -- which is a problem in most of downtown San Diego. I've stayed in much better places for the money (after wheeling and dealing on the internet) but this time I had to book quickly. Paid about $100 including taxes and fees.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Lawhelan
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Everything is new at this amazing hotel. Built around an interior courtyard it must have had a previous life, but now everything is modern, top of the line, and gorgeous. Our room was comfortable and luxurious. Parking was very convenient and nearby. Service was friendly and professional. But the restaurant/bar is the most amazing- The Glass Door is on the 4th floor with fab views over the harbor from the dining room or terrace. With very few tables it was cozy and intimate, with great food and service. We met friends in the bar and the drinks were excellent- good selection of wines and booze. The hotel is walking distance to Little Italy. I can't say enough good things! We were told they're adding a roof garden with fire pits....

Reviews.Title: “An Interesting Find”
Reviews.Author: somobr
Reviews.Content: We were heading off to the Comic Con in San Diego. the one convention that literally brings San Diego to a standstill and sends hotel prices absolutely rocketing. After many weeks of trying to find a reasonably priced hotel, (Best Western were charging $700p/n) my partner finally choose this hotel. I couldn't find many reviews except recently renovated property, near Little Italy...We took our chances and were pleasantly surprised. The initial feel when you enter the Front Desk is very warm and welcoming, but you can tell it is an old motel that has been renovated. The rooms were "cosy" but clean, with nice bedding, fresh sheets and a nice yet small bathroom. The staff were extremely friendly, however, could probably do with a bit more local knowledge although they did have a helpful attitude, as long as you have the patience. Had plenty of free parking - always a plus, and was one street back from Little Italy's fantastic Italian Restaurants. About a 10 minute walk to the water, 20 mins to the Convention Centre but a very beautiful walk none the less so don't let this put you off. As we were there they were just trialling their restaurant for breakfast and lunch and later they were to open for dinner. All in all, considering we were there at San Diego's busiest time of the year, it was a great little hotel - priced well compared to the excessively over priced hotels for the Comic Con so we were happy with this rough diamond !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just the worse possible experience ever, and I have pics too.”
Reviews.Author: ladybugmomma
Reviews.Content: This place is a freakin mess! Read the review before mine....dated August 17th 2008; http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g60750-d650054-Reviews-Porto_Vista_Hotel_Suites-San_Diego_California.html Now read my similar experience. This was the last leg of a 10 day vacation. We spent 2 days at a "budget" hotel in Tulare CA (while visiting Sequoia Natonial Park) and then 5 days in Anaheim @ the Sheraton. We were expecting 2 equally fun days in San Diego. All three of our hotel stays were booked on line. No problem at all until we made our way to Porto Vista hotel. This was our last stop on the vacation. It was 8-8-8 and our son turned 8 on this day. We decided to take him to San Diego to see the Air & Space Musuem and also the USS Midway. These people at this hotel seriously tried to put a damper on my son's day. We arrived early to find that our room was not ready yet. We decided to go do some laundry while waiting for our room. I asked where the nearest laundromat was and got a snobby "IN DOWNTOWN"??? response from the clerk. We left and found a laundromat (yes they have them DOWNTOWN) and returned a couple of hours later. Our room (just like the previous reviewers) was SMALL. I had a printout with me of our reservation. We had reserved a room for 5, with microwave, refrigerator and a roll out. They put us in a TINY room with 2 beds and NO PLACE to put the roll out. You could barely fit 5 people in this room. There was a desk and table but it was all so cramped. NO refrigerator, NO microwave. My husband went down to the desk and the clerk rudely informed him to "check his reservations" and told us that we hadn't reserved a microwave and refrigerator (flat out said it wasn't on our reservations) and that she could put us in a bigger room but charge us more. I was so mad! I called choicehotels customer service and they called the service desk. They basically told customer service another lie and said they put me in a "upgraded, larger" room and would be wiling to charge me the same. This made me even more mad. Here they were actually giving me the hotel room I had ordered under the guise of an "upgrade". Two men brought in a rollaway, and even being the "larger" room, it wouldn't fit. They had to move the table in front of the bathroom door (which blocked the cabinet to the refrigerator and micro and also partially blocked the bathroom door in addition to making the table unusable) and then once the table was moved that made room for the slide out UP AGAINST the a/c. The staff was snotty and arrogant. The hotel was a mess. The a/c's dripped on the carpet. They can't blame this on a remodel. There wasn't even soap in my room. There was some dumb shoe sponge and a shower cap, but no soap. They get a lot of activity here from the downtown party crowd. They cater to those that are there for the nightlife. Parking is insane, because the partygoers take all the hotel guests parking. They give you a parking permit for your car, yet they don't do anything about those that are parked there without a permit. I filed a formal complaint with choicehotels.com. This hotel was advertised as part of "The Clarion Collection". 6 days after our trip I received a call from a "Grace". She basically said the same thing she told the last guy. She blamed it on the website. She said that they had complained to choicehotels because there rooms were loaded wrong. If that's the case then why do their clerks treat the customer so bad when it turns out there is a SUPPOSED discrepency? She also went on to say that complaining about the website to choicehotels wouldn't do me any good because all the complaints go back to her. She went on to say they like to think of themselves as "independent" and seperate themselves from choicehotels intentionally and they are in the process of breaking away into another name...I believe she said ASCENT.....personally, staying here is a downhill experience, it should be called DESCENT. One more thing, she said the rollaways were new and they had noticed they were big (if that's the case they should have been prepared to place a customer that had ordered a rollaway into a room that would fit the) and that they used to use air mattresses and were thinking of going back to them. Once again, they cater to the party crowd. Now I know where the clerks get their snobby attitudes from.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: PREPXPRESS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great neighborhood and has very nice initial appearance. The lobby is beautiful which leads you to believe that the room will be the same, but they are not. The standard rooms at this hotel are very disappointing. The hotel website boasted that each room has a refridgerator and microwave, but there was none in our rooms. When I asked the manager about this, she stated that the website had given false information, but it was their own website! The outside walkways had carpet and the air conditioners constantly leaked onto the carpet, which gave off a very offensive odor. This is definitely just a hotel for sleep only. If you stay here do not get a standard room. I cannot attest to the quality of the suites or any other larger rooms, but the statndard rooms are not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Garsha30
Reviews.Content: Restaurant and bar are finally open on the fourth floor of the hotel. The bar has outside seating that has a fantastic view of the harbor. Rooms are nice, updated, and clean. A very comfortable place to stay with a desk to do work, TV, sink, and fridge. Free internet access. The hotel offers a free airport shuttle which also goes to Sea World and the Zoo. The trolley station is just a short walk away, with quick access to all of San Diego. The walk to Petco Park was just over a mile. The hotel staff is extremely pleasant and responds quickly to all issues. The gave us a free upgrade to a King Bed. When we got to the room, the bed as not made up. They came immediately to clean the room and change the linens. Hotel is a short walk from the harbor, and Little Italy, a nice part of town with numerous restaurants and shops. When we return to San Diego, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: SCVTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage sons, and I went to San Diego for three days, midweek to go on a charter fishing boat. I shopped around for hours for the best deal on a hotel. The day before we left, I decided on Porto Vista based on TripAdvisor reviews, the Clarion website, and other travel sites. I booked the room on the Clarion website. I paid about $140 a night inc. taxes. Websites were unclear regarding parking-some said it was free, some said there was a fee. I called the hotel to find out and was told it is currently free but limited. We arrived at the hotel, which is located north of downtown and just a few blocks from the USS Midway, and greeted by a very friendly staff. I was a little concerned about noise since we were about 2 short blocks east of the train tracks and just south of the airport. Our room was interesting. The far wall was a sliding glass door which was the bathroom door. Thankfully it was frosted glass but provided no privacy-not even on the toilet. It would have been fine for a husband and wife but not great for a family with teens. From what I could tell, there weren't many rooms like that. We were in 555 so judging by the arcitechture, the rooms on each floor below us were the same and possibly on the other side of the hotel as well. Sure they would have moved us if I complained but it wasn't a huge issue. The room ended up being very quite with only an occassional train during the night and planes in the early AM but it was light at night as there was no way to cover the sliding bathroom door and there was a window in the bathroom with no covering. The beds were firm and possibly the most comfortable beds we've slept on. Linens were excellent. The room was fairly clean...my only complaint was the track of the sliding door was sandy and the glass was only clean on the sliding portion. If housekeeping would shut that door while in the bathroom they could clean the track and the glass. It's something many house cleaners make even in their own homes! Remodel is still going on but never an inconvenience to us. Great value in a great location! Also...there is no pool, just a large hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great downton location”
Reviews.Author: travelclick
Reviews.Content: Exactly as advertised on Tripadvisor - basic, clean with a friendly staff. Close to the airport (planes don't fly here between midnight and 5 a.m.) and a decent rate as they are remodelling but as we stayed over the weekend it did not affect us. I'd stay there again at this price. One thing - the web site mentions the restaurant and bar - neither of these were ready to open yet (June '08) and there was no breakfast (they offered us a coupon for a free cup of coffee at a nearby restaurant) but as the hotel is only half a block to Little Italy and some of San Diego's best restaurants and cafe's, not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PortoVistaReviewer
Reviews.Content: Here is a complete review of our recent stay: Location: Walking distance (5 minutes) to the harbor, USS Midway, trolley, and great restaurants. 5 minute trolley to Gaslamp or Old Town. Little Italy has beautiful architecture, very friendly people, and of course great food. There is a small neighborhood park right behind the hotel that is awesome. Very family friendly and priceless for our 2 year old. Every Saturday has a street market one block from the hotel--fresh paninis, bread, fruit, etc. Hotel: Still under construction, but nothing too major. Restaurant and jacuzzi are still not open. Construction noise during the day is not too bad, turn on the AC and you can barely hear it. Though my husband was more bothered by it than I was. Elevator: So slow we never used it in 4 days, though it is brand new. Construction workers utilized it so maybe that is why it was so slow. Lobby: Absolutely gorgeous. One small room with one computer for guest use, though I was told the internet wasn't working on it since there were so many people logged on to their wireless. Manager: Extremeley helpful and sincere. Upon check in we were given a room that didn't have a view of the harbor. I asked if there was something available with a view and was immediately given a suite with balcony and view of harbor and the hotel was completely booked. (We checked in around 3:30 pm) Rooms: Get one on the north or west side of the hotel and on the 3rd, 4th, or 5th floor. The west side might only have the more expensive suites, but our room was on the third floor, north side and had a balcony with a view of the harbor and the price was for a queen, 2 people. Since it faced north it also had a view of all of the airplanes landing--our 2 year old LOVED watching them and they are very frequent during the day and almost non existant during the night. The plane noise never bothered us. We were the first guests to stay in our particular room since it was completed so everything was brand new. Windows open for fresh air, refrigerator, wet bar. There were 2 tv's, one in the bedroom and one in the living room--not very many channels to choose from, but if you are in San Diego then chances are you won't be sitting in your room watching tv. Some noise from neighbors was heard, but nothing out of the ordinary for a hotel. Bath and Body Works soaps are very nice too. Note for families with young children--some windows have a low sill and open with only a screen that could easily be pushed out--very dangerous when you are 3-5 floors up. We kept those windows locked. Maid Service: Terrible. We didn't have any for 2 out of our 4 nights. We had to go to the front desk to get towels, etc. Luckily the front desk employees were always very nice and helpful. One day I was in the room and a few minutes after I put up the do not disturb sign I heard the maid cart pass our room. I opened the door and asked if they could just take the trash and give us towels and he said "no, you had the card up"....not the best customer service. Shuttle: Terrible. I read previous reviews saying it was great. Not our experience. There was a large convention while we were visiting so the shuttle was available only for them, not other guests. After the convention was over, we wanted a shuttle to the zoo but we were told that it left the hotel at 9 am---the zoo opens at 9 am and if you are not there early you will be waiting in a very long line. We asked if they could make an exception since the shuttle was just sitting there at 830, but nope--it leaves at 9. Funny, just the day before we saw the shuttle give a ride to 3 people to the zoo after they asked at 830. Parking: FREE. Unheard of in San Diego. Overall: Very helpful, nice employees at the front desk and very good manager. Great location. Very family friendly but don't stay here if you are looking for a "sit by the pool" type of vacation. The construction is finishing up and they are still ironing out glitches, but if we go back to San Diego, there is no question that this is where we will stay. Remember, get a room on the west or north side on the 3rd, 4th, or 5th floor--the closer to the west side, the better.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ajyacht
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after reading a bad review on the first hotel I had booked. For maybe $10 per night more we changed reservation for this location. It was so worth it! This should be a beautfiul building when completed. Nice views from the roof of the Bay, watched the cruise ships leave. Close to everything. Walked to dinner, the Red Bull air show the next day, walked back to Little Italy. Room was clean, air conditioning/heater worked great! The only thing I would change is add a hook in the bathroom to hang towels from. Plan to stay in the future. Just hope they won't raise the prices too much when all the work is complete!

Reviews.Title: “Website Errors and Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: arizonamom77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in April 2008. The website states they have a restaurant (open 4/08)-NOPE. It also says there is a 30 person jaccuzzi pool-WRONG AGAIN. It's there but doesn't have any water. The site also has a list of items that are standard in every room. We did not have a "Comfortable two seat activity table or lounge chair with ottoman", and neither did our aunt who was also staying at the hotel. She had a room on the 5th floor that was barely large enough for the single bed, but the bathroom was gigantic. Her room did not have a Microwave oven and compact refrigerator. What really sucked about my stay here was on the last day, we called for a luggage cart to be sent up so we could load our car. The hotel only has two very old and used carts that don't match. We were told they were being used by the housekeeping staff. No offer to have the maids bring one down so we could load our car up or have someone help us with all our bags. We were literally the only guests in the hotel except for our aunt, and the parking lot was full of vehicles from the construction crew so we couldn't even pull our truck up close to the elevator. I had to ask if they were going to have someone bring our bags down since they couldn't let us use a cart, and was put on hold for a few minutes while they scrambled around in the lobby. My room was overlooking them and I could see them all talking to each other. I really don't see why they didn't just do what any other hotel would do and let us use the stupid luggage cart. When I did get into the elevator I saw what they were being used for...one of the maids had a big box of Kleenex; she was putting boxes of tissues in all the rooms. The front desk felt that was more important than making the GUEST'S stay 100% perfect. With the prices they are trying to charge at this place they really need to do everything they can to please the guests, which they do not. Stay away, many other hotels in the area will treat you better! For less!

Reviews.Title: “I was warned”
Reviews.Author: graymace
Reviews.Content: I was warned that the property was under construction. The room we had was extremely small but clean enough. The location was good for walking to the bay and Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Rooms, Low Price”
Reviews.Author: seven3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in May 2007 based on recommendations and the forum here at Tripadvisor. I'll reiterate the comments that others have posted here: Pros: 1) The rooms were very clean - a pleasant surprise as the outside of the hotel looks a bit messy (as it used to be a motel and is under renovations). 2) Location - the hotel is within walking distance to the tram stop and all the restaurants in Little Italy. 3) Price - what can I say...I love lower prices... Cons: The Porto Vista used to be a Motel 8; so it does feel a bit dodgy when you first arrive. However, when the renovations are done, I'd assume it will be much better. Note - this hotel is away from the main city center and has a residential feel when walking around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Noise was Terrible”
Reviews.Author: SmoovD
Reviews.Content: Well. This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel. They have been doing major construction to expand their rooms. They are one of the cheapest hotels in the area. Close to the airport and within walking distance of the beach and local trolley which can connect you to the other major attractions in the area. The only problem with this hotel is they have been doing major construction for the past year and from what I've seen they won't be done with it till November of 2008. If you like being woken up at 5AM by loud construction noises and even loader construction workers profanity and yelling, this is the hotel for you. Oh, and be sure to stay on the first floor or in a suite otherwise you won't get one of their upgraded beds with the pillow top mattress. You'll be stuck with an oldschool hard spring mattress.Hope this helps in your decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great for the money”
Reviews.Author: mswin62
Reviews.Content: great loaction 10 minutes walk to horton plaza very helpful staff!!! only problem building work but i didn't hear anything till after 8am and very clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Clean, Great location”
Reviews.Author: thegame_911
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction during our stay, so we got a good price on it. There was some noise during the day, but we weren't in the hotel that much. Breakfast was pretty basic, but the food was pretty good. The hotel is in little Italy, with tons of cool restaurants around. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to the train, so we didn't need to rent a car. The hotel has free transportation to the airport, seaworld and the zoo. The driver was super nice and offered us lots of great tips.

Reviews.Title: “Encore- Stay Away!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tophercb
Reviews.Content: First the hotel is impossible to find because the neon signs do not bear the name SUPER 8!!! It has another name-brillant! To say there is not enough parking is an understatement.. The rooms smell bad of mold and mildew. It might be cheaper than other hotels in the area, except motel 6 near by, but not cheap enough for the condition of the hotel. It is way over priced particularly if you get a room in the old section under construction. The staff is immune to what must be daily complaints. It is an ownership that is immune to the welfare of their guests as we are told the place is being sold to another chain. Do yourself a favor STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super room in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: ticord
Reviews.Content: We utilized TripAdvisor recent reviews and fotos and deemed this worth the chance: construction/remodel ongoing . B/C truly large, high ceiling rooms [at least on 5th floor] and easy access to the 5th floor deck with chairs and tables overlooking Little Italy and views of the waterfront for morning relaxing with continental breakfast snacks brought up from lobby area and late afternoon/evening relaxing with a drink before going to nearby Little Italy for dinner. SUPER to not be confined to a hotel/motel room. King bedroom for a couple is ideal spaceous room. Tiny frigibar with modest temp only [mgt should use larger mini refig &/or style with cooler temp] means you need to keep ice bucket full inside it and your then set for chilled soda, snacks, etc. Microwave if needed. Nice cherrywood furnishings. Large bathroom with marble tile floors [could use a wet towel hook or two and there is space to spare for a vertical shelf rack. A/C is perfect when needed. So what - there's construction next door at Motel 8 as part of remodel. So, what there's an add on under construction the other side of the Motel 8. So what - there's no room views. So, what - there's "reach out and touch" jets landing nearby - the noise was Not noticeable and views from 5th floor deck were great! Location is primo: close to Little Italy eats, no street noise, close to trolley, close to 7-11 for day trip stock ups, close to airport. Forget there's no outside or inside grounds! You're going to be out and about on trolley [nearby] and connecting buses to entire City and La Jolla beaches [#30 bus from 1st & Ash or Old Town Transportation Center after trolley ride to it]. Check out Zucchero for a great full breakfast and great pasteries and gelato later in day/evening. Check out Mimmos for a great lunch [thin crust pizza by slice with great salads. Check out any of the many Italian eateries for lunch and dinner [Zia's & Vincenzo, etc.]. Plus, Filipi's for Italian traditional meals and deep dish pizza - long lines wotrh it. Shuttle driver at airport within 5-10 minutes of call. Very courteous and helpful sites to see explanation on drive in. Staff accommodating. Mr/Mrs R. Diaz Arlington, TX

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Close to the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: shawn44
Reviews.Content: We paid $150 for a two bedroom room on a Saturday night. In terms of price/location, it will be tough to beat this as it's probably a 10-15 minute walk tot he Gaslamp district and in a nice, safe neighborhood (Little Italy, actually). The rooms are a little old and not the nicest, but they were decent enough and not filthy or anything. Yes, there is construction going on that makes it an eye-sore, but it's a Super 8 Motel! You aren't going for the views! And by no means was the construction loud or dangerous or anything else. All in all, if you're looking for a place where you simply want to sleep in Downtown San Diego, this is a good bet as the price wasn't too bad and it's walkable to many great restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel - when it's built and finished”
Reviews.Author: steverSEEngland
Reviews.Content: Booked this on-line using hotels own web site. Everything seemed so perfect - location, amenities etc. What the web site failed to mention is that the hotel is only part built and that the complimentary breakfast is located in a 5ft x 10ft lobby. Based on the artists impression, the hotel will be great when it is finished in early 2008 but until then it is no more that the Super 8 motel that it is being merged with - Bates Motel has more appeal. The only good thing was that I was able to use the complimentary WiFi to find an alternative hotel. Reservation was for 6 nights, checked-out after 1. Not the place I want to spend a family vacation. Steve, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tacy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the process of renovation so it didn't look like much from outside. But we had a beautiful room on the 5th floor--high ceilings, imported bath fixtures, a great view from the exterior walkway balcony. Staff was very friendly. Location in LIttle Italy is great. So many San Diego hotels seem to be right on top of the highway--this one is not. Only drawback is the exterior hallways. They can be scary with small children (and a mom afraid of heights and of their falling).

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mondaygirl
Reviews.Content: We were not told this place was under construction when we booked it on Expedia. The whole front of the building is missing and covered with a plastic tarp, as well as mant of the rooms being gutted. The whole place smells like mold in the worst way. The end of the 4th story balcony was covered with a piece of plywood. This is a motel that caters to families with children! Avoid this place at all costs! See attached pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Porto Vista”
Reviews.Author: Fallwedding
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Porto Vista for the MCRD graduation for my brother and enjoyed our stay at this hotel. As other reviews have stated this is being renovated, so expect some construction going on. None of this was a bother to us at all. Upon arriving we booked a standard queen room and were given an upgrade to the King Suite. The staff at the front desk and the drivers were always friendly and saying hello. Great customer service. Our room was on the fifth floor and it had a great view of San Diego, you could see Little Italy, Downtown and the airport. Rooms: Very clean. The beds were comfy. We also had a mini frig, microwave, coffee maker in our room. (we did have a good chuckle when we noticed both pictures on the walls were the same scene) Overall this was a great place to stay at. One downfall for families staying there are the bathrooms. If it is just you and your husband/wife the bathrooms are fine. But they have a sliding glass door. Can't see through 100%, but we felt that this could have been laid out differently. Safe residential location. My husband and I walked in the early a.m. to Starbucks and people were out walking. Everyone very nice and saying "good morning" "hello" One more thing...great places eat in Little Italy. Wonderful pizza at Flippes. Across the street. Enjoy the Porto Vista. Going to be an amazing place when completed. (roof top pool) Great views!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I expected - excalty”
Reviews.Author: Jerome R
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the suite. Place still under construction/renovation. Great location. Had view of elementary school and park across the street, planes landing and 5 freeway. Great morning sun, high ceilings, and big suite 540. Little Italy is a great little neighborhood. Basic satellite, not all channels worked, details not finished in room. But enjoyed the morning sun and watching the planes land.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples, not kids!”
Reviews.Author: hisrib
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very pleased. The shuttle van driver was just WONDERFUL, he was waiting for us at the airport and pointed out museums and the best places to eat in Little Italy. He also took us to the zoo and picked us up early when our two little ones were too tired to last any longer. He also ran us out to SeaWorld and after, dropped us off at Denny's to eat! Little Italy is great but not so much so if you have toddlers. We had our 23 month old son and our 3 year old daughter. I asked for a crib for my son and they tossed a pack and play into our room with no sheets. We had a double queen bed room and it was EXTREMELY small but BEAUTIFULLY decorated, and the beds are so comfortable! (we removed the pillow top from ours) The bathroom was so large we parked our huge double stroller in it! Even after my kids took a loooooooooong bath, then my husband a shower, I took a shower and the water stayed hot forever! The bathroom had a sliding glass door so you could pretty much see whatever somebody was doing in the bathroom. It was the type of glass where you can't see details on a person but left nothing to the imagination! The first night we just lay there covered in sweat. We had the a/c pumping on high and all the covers off the beds but it was terrible! Nobody would answer the phone at the super 8 front desk either! Maintenance fixed it the next day, the front desk people acted like they didn't care. The morning "breakfast' is terrible, just coffee and juice with some stale pastries, no cereal or milk or fruit. All the rooms have refrigerators so if you want basic groceries, make a left out of the hotel and a right on Cedar to the 7-11. Our fridge held a six pack of Bud, gallon of milk, and 2 liter of coke comfortably. To get to Denny's make a right out of the hotel on Columbia St and left on Hawthorn, it's right near the water and there is also a chinese place next door. You could really get by without a car, I wanted the kids to see the beach so we paid the $20 each way cab fare to go out to Mission Beach. Really, it was the perfect couples place with so many bars and restaurants, but we never saw any kids but ours! When I say kids I mean anybody under the age of 25! There was a small park behind the hotel that my kids loved. Oh I should also mention planes fly by every 4-5 minutes and yes you CAN hear them in your room, so light sleepers beware. We brought a fan with us to run all night long. All in all, we were pleased, we paid $129 a night and booked directly through them. They have a lot of construction going on, the Super 8 that they are connected to is a DUMP. (see photo) you have to use Super 8's lobby to check in and get the so called "breakfast" Really though, for free shuttle service to and from the airport, zoo, and SeaWorld, plus a beautiful room with a comfy bed you probably can't get a better deal in San Diego. I probably won't stay here again, just because I'd liked to be close to the water. I spent 2 days straight researching hotels before we left and this one worked out all right. Feel free to contact me directly.......lisacodding@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place!”
Reviews.Author: payne0295
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the newly renovated Porto Vista Hotel from March 24 to March 27, 2007 and it is a wonderful, fabulous place! Their beds are more comfortable than ours at home, no joke! We are usually so ready to get back to "our own bed" but not at this hotel. But their best asset has to be their staff. They were so friendly and helpful. So much so that I felt the need to write the District Manager a letter praising them. The Shuttle Van driver inparticular was fantastic. And they offer complimentary shuttle to several places locally. The hotel is in the Little Italy section of town and is very convenient to everything downtown and close to a train station to get to other parts of town. We will definately stay at the Porto Vista again on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Left immediately!”
Reviews.Author: PWTraveller
Reviews.Content: Made reservations online and was upset to see the pictures looked NOTHING like the ads. First of all the construction was clearly in site. Some rooms were knocked out and dangerous wires and debris were in the walking way. We asked to see a room before we checked in. They assured we were staying in new renovated rooms. We still asked to see. They gave us a key to the older section and said the new rooms weren't really theirs. They were still under hotel negociations to buy the newer property. In the mean time we went to see the room. It smelled musty, the carpet dingy and was a few doors down from where the knocked out rooms were. We declined. The management insisted we would not get rooms anywhere else in San Diego, and even our attempts to ask for another Super 8 were rebuffed. Rude and incompetent. The area around the hotel was questionable as well. There was absolutely no parking available and gravel everywhere. DO NOT STAY HERE! Go to Hotel Circle Dr. Many friendly hotels with great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice”
Reviews.Author: glynndak
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Super 8 Bayview/Convention Center over the weekend of Dec 9-11. Had I known about the construction I would have booked another hotel, but since we arrived on a Saturday, the construction did not bother us. Our room was nice, clean, but not overly clean. The front desk staff was friendly and nice. There is a "PARDON OUR DUST" sign in the lobby for all guests. This hotel is located in Downtown San Diego in an area called LITTLE ITALY. You are about 3 blocks from the San Diego Trolley. Strolling through Little Italy to the Trolley is nice, as you pass many nice shops and restaurants on the way. The hotel does offer a small and limited continential breakfast in the morning and there is a nice little patio to sit out on. There are many great restaurants in Little Italy and it is nice the hotel does not compete with them. If you stayed on the 2nd floor or higer, there is a locked gate you had to open with your room key, which to me was an added safety feature of the hotel. The hotel offers a shuttle to and from the airport, Sea World, The San Diego Zoo and the Cruise Ship Terminal. The shuttle is free. Whenever the construction is done, this hotel will be very nice and could earn a higher star rating. Great amenties, good locataion...should be called the Super 8/Bayview/Little Italy. I would stay again after all the construction is done.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel - Loved Little Ilaty”
Reviews.Author: JenninHtown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bay View Super 8 December 2, 2006 and were very pleased with the hotel. The hotel staff is friendly, helpful and pleasant. We called the hotel to pick us up from the airport â€“ the van was prompt and free. There was a janitor at the hotel cleaning outside all day long as well as the typical maids cleaning the rooms. We stayed in room 402, which had a great view on the outside wrap around balcony. The room itself was very clean with a small refrigerator and microwave. The bathroom was clean with plenty of towels. The bed and pillows were clean and we slept comfortable. The carpet and chairs in this room were clean. I would recommend this hotel as well as stay here again. There is construction on one side of the hotel, but they are not putting guest on that side. They work from 7 - 4:30 daily except on Sunday â€“ this never bother us. This hotel is four blocks from the bay, three blocks from the trolley, and one block from the Little Italy District. Little Italy is a very clean safe and a quant part of town. Several restaurants, pubs and a few boutiques are within walking distance of this hotel. This place is not fancy, but very clean, safe and a great price. We paid $85.00 for one night with the frig and microwave in our room which we thought was a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay a second night”
Reviews.Author: pacifico
Reviews.Content: The San Diego Super 8 Bayview is indeed well-located to restaurants and the harbor, but even its good location does not make up for the dirt, grime, and trash around the rooms and motel. And our room was supposed to be newly renovated! After the first night, we changed our San Diego plans just so we could stay elsewhere. Weâ€™ve stayed in lots of Super 8 motels and did not expect a fine hotel, but at $125 a night, this was far below their standard. Even their meager continental breakfast (box of doughnuts?) was unavailable when promised.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the cost.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa828
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ the Super 8 for 7 days while @ a convention downtown. I stayed in the older portion of the building "Classic Super 8" if you will, and what can I say. It was small, the bed not too comfy, the towels were thin and kind of scratchy, there were workmen because of the conctruction there from 8-4. I didn't really find any physical problems. More or less, this hotel isn't the best where luxury is concerned, however, I got a great rate @ 75/night and was able to afford to rent a car to drive around. The hotel is in the Little Italy area, with lots of easy, safe walks to restaurants, etc., and also an easy walk downtown. Ground traffic was pretty quiet, though I am from a city, so noise doesn't really bother me, and the planes landing were a little loud, but I turned on my air unit and had no issues. If you like comfort and luxury, go to the Marriott, or Hyatt and pay 2-250 a night. If you can deal, and want to makes ends meet and have some money to spend stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: janeofdec
Reviews.Content: This isn't too bad of a place to stay. We have stayed here two years in a roll when we come to a convention in San Diego. The first year I went it was an okay experience. What I liked most was the staff was really friendly. There was construction although that you could hear starting at about 8 am each morning. This didn't bother us because we were getting up early. The breakfast is just juice, coffee and muffins. Simple but okay. The pool is really nice. Our most recent stay in July was not so great as the first. I paid $139 for each night in a regular 1 bed room. The construction from last year was STILL being completed. Our second morning there, our bathroom ceiling started leaking badly. The manager was not nice to us and didn not even apologize. We were given a new room in about an hour. But it was quite a hassle having to wait so long to use the restroom and shower - not to mention repacking and moving rooms. The manager's customer service was very poor. I was extremely disappointed how she treated her guests. We were not given an apology or any type of discount for the inconvience. A new thing this year was they installed locks on the doors (they did not have them last year). So the added security was nice. Our second room had crappy lighting, and you don't have many options of TV channels. The cable is really limited. The TV's do not have VCR's, nor can you attach your own (the TV's have no imputs). Their blankets are kind of thin, so we always bring an extra one.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible - but kinda shabby”
Reviews.Author: MrPizz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, because I had a job interview the next morning and I wanted to be within walking distance. My room was on the ground floor at the end of a hallway directly adjacent to a big construction site. There were literally construction materials a foot away from the door to my room, and the whole area was dusty and gross. The room itself was smallish, dark, and in bad need of renovation. It was a smoking room - so there was a strong perfume smell that they had apparently added to mask the smell (frankly, stale cigarette smoke would have been more pleasant). The best part of this hotel is its location, you are steps away from Little Italy which has a string of nice restaurants, and you can easily walk anywhere downtown. The airport is also just a short 10-15 min drive away. In summary, I would only stay here if you wanted to be downtown, and were looking for a totally no-frills room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Place”
Reviews.Author: UCFTraveler
Reviews.Content: The common lodging phrase, "you get what you pay for" is evident here. I paid $67.00 per night at this location. This was not a bad hotel for a Super 8. The room was clean, the air conditioner worked well, the water pressure and shower temperature were perfect, and the bed was comfortable. It is located in Little Italy with alot of great Italian restaurants nearby. It is also located directly near Interstate 5, basically one exit away from San Diego International Airport, and a nice catholic church is a block away. The location is great. They have free parking, although a tight squeeze I never had a problem parking my rental car. I did not bother trying the continental breakfast, so I am unable to comment. You do feel somewhat safe here because in order to get up to floors 2-4, you have to use your room key. They are currently undergoing a 45 room addition, so it can be noisy from all the construction. I was up and out both days prior to the construction beginning, so no complaints about that. Would I stay here again? Maybe, if I was unable to find more higher end accomodations at a reasonable price. All in all, not a bad place. Oh, and the prior comment is correct. It is located in the landing path of the airport. Planes literally come so close by you can almost see the people on the flights! It is amazing to me! I thought it was so cool, so I did not mind the noise (which is not really that bad).

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: coach9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Super 8 Bayview for four nights in mid-March. The hotel had some good points, namely its shuttle to SeaWorld and the Zoo. There is only one departure/pick-up time, so you have to sign up ahead of time. With a six-year old in tow, the time frame given was a long enough day for us, but some people might feel rushed. The majority of the staff was friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable. You're within walking distance of the bay and Little Italy. The Bad: The landing pattern for the airport is almost directly above the hotel. If you're a light sleeper, even the white noise from the old fan in the room won't be enough. The continental breakfast was pitiful compared to others we've had. We ended up walking about six blocks to Denny's for breakfast. The Ugly: When we arrived, our room was poorly cleaned and the quality of housekeeping did not improve over the time we were there. We had two rooms booked; one had problems with the bathroom. Overall, I would not return to this hotel. As stated earlier, it is an OLD Super 8 that really needs some work done. I really don't think it was worth the amount of money we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Peace&Quiet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights precruise. The location was great, which was our main reason for staying at this hotel. They have a free shuttle that takes you to the zoo which is very convienient. They also have one that goes to Sea World. There's only one departure and pickup time for each location..so make your reservations as soon as you check in. The motel itself is typical Super 8. Clean...but kind of shabby. Which sometimes makes the rooms have a seedy feel to them. Poor lighting doesn't help!! Which is why I would probably not stay here again. Unless they do some major remodeling. I feel the price they charge is two much for this quality accomodations. But again you are paying for the location. We are no stranger to Super 8 motels. We are usually traveling on a budget. But normally we would pay at least 20.00 per night less at another Super 8. The free continental breakfast was assorted pastries and muffins...and of course coffee, tea and juice. It wasn't bad. Especially if you like to eat light in the morning. Some of the past reviews led me to believe this Super 8 was nicer than other Super 8's. I am sorry to report that this is not the case.

Reviews.Title: “One star rating- totally not true!!! Stay here ASAP!”
Reviews.Author: alliebaby33
