Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here for the past two nights and enjoyed my time so much! Yes- its right by the airport- and you can hear the planes when you are outside.... yes there is construction that starts at 8am and you can hear it sometimes.... but OVERALL- it is a cheap- totally clean- friendly great place to stay in one of the very safest neighborhoods. They shuttled us to the zoo and back and to the amtrak station for free and it was only $79 a night. We had a great time and the sunsets from teh 3rd floor are breathtaking- if you want a 4 star then pay $200+ for a room- if you enjoy a value- stay here- we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Room was nice for the price - had a slightly odd smell, but was not really a problem. For someone that enjoys a 30 minute walk, it is fantastic. I found it close enough to walk to most places I wanted to go - walked to Balboa Park, Downtown, Seaport etc. If walking is not your thing, it has shuttles to the Zoo, and is very close to the Metro (County Center/Little Italy). If you stay, make sure to try Felippi's Pizza Grotto on India St just around the corner. And Caffe Italia had superb coffee. Also the elevator is reliable which is nice (See photo).

Reviews.Title: “Rooms okay, but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_68
Reviews.Content: The location is not bad being residential and quiet, and close to "Little Italy" area of town. The rooms are clean but nothing special. The hotel service leaves to be desired. When I arrived, the key to my room didn't work, and it took me 4 trips to the reception desk, to get them to fix the problem. I didn't feel a "welcome" feeling in this place, so I was glad when I left.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ytse411
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the week of 12/4-12/10. We reserved a single queen bed room, and the night we arrived we were told that the construction would not be noisy in the morining. Uh, no. They start working at 8am on the dot. The construction is literally outside your door - you can shake the scaffolding if you like. If you are an early riser, then these rooms won't be a problem. It was extremely clean, but small. All single queen bed rooms are on the construction side. It did smell like rug shampoo, so maybe the staff read some previous reviews! The construction is expected to be completed in April 06. The next morning I asked to be moved to the other side, and for an extra $10 a night, it was so worth it. Definitely spring for the double queen rooms - much bigger and quieter. I should have heeded the advice of the previous reviewers! I highly suggest staying on the other side with the double beds! Again, extremely clean. The staff were also very nice and knowledgable about the area, as posted by previous reviewers. The breakfast is coffee, juice and a very small tabletop counter which had various muffins and pastries, not enough for an actual breakfast, but good for a snack. Just be sure to check your food first, on my last day as I was peeling the wrapper from a muffin, a not so small but very dead beetle fell off of it. (I'm sure this could happen anywhere though.) The view rocks, just like the pictures posted by a previous reviewer. No matter what floor you're on, go up to the 4th (top) floor and check out the skyline, especially at sunset! It really is a nice view. The motel is located in a safe area, as we walked around almost every night and never felt less than safe. We didn't use the pool or jacuzzi but they were very small and not lit at night which I thought was odd. Bottom line-the rooms are very clean, all the staff we encountered were very friendly, it's in a safe area and it was cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Location of this motel is great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the bay view every day. We could walk everywhere. The motel staff was helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Porto Vista Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1835 Columbia Street, San Diego, CA 92101
